recipes.name: Kabuli Pulao
recipes.description: A flavorful Afghan rice dish made with lamb or beef, raisins, and carrots.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent.
Add the meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the rice, water, and salt. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the raisins and carrots to the pot, and stir gently.
Cover the pot again and simmer for another 10-15 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Bolani
recipes.description: A traditional Afghan flatbread filled with mashed potatoes, onions, and spices.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix together the mashed potatoes, onion, cilantro, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper.
Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and roll each piece into a thin circle on a lightly floured surface.
Spread a few tablespoons of the potato mixture onto one half of each circle, leaving a small border around the edge.
Fold the other half of the dough over the filling and pinch the edges together to seal.
In a large skillet, heat about 1/2 inch of vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Fry each bolani for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate and serve hot.

recipes.name: Byrek
recipes.description: A savory Albanian pie made with phyllo dough, spinach, and feta cheese.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent.
Add the spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. Season with salt and black pepper.
Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the feta cheese.
Brush a baking dish with olive oil.
Lay one sheet of phyllo dough in the dish and brush it with olive oil. Repeat with 5 more sheets of phyllo dough.
Spread the spinach mixture over the phyllo dough.
Layer 6 more sheets of phyllo dough on top, brushing each sheet with olive oil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the phyllo dough is golden brown and crispy.
Cut into squares and serve hot.

recipes.name: Tave Kosi
recipes.description: A delicious Albanian lamb and yogurt casserole with a custard-like topping.
ingredients: 1 pound lamb, cut into small pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, cook the lamb over medium heat until browned on all sides.
Transfer the lamb to a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix together the yogurt, eggs, rice flour, melted butter, salt, black pepper, and cinnamon.
Pour the yogurt mixture over the lamb in the baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the custard-like topping is golden brown and set.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Couscous
recipes.description: A traditional dish made of semolina, meat and vegetables.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until soft.
Add the lamb or chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the vegetables, chickpeas, salt, and pepper, and cook for 5-10 minutes.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the couscous to the pot and stir to combine.
Cover the pot and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the couscous is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the couscous with a fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: Brik
recipes.description: A crispy pastry filled with egg and tuna.
ingredients: 4 sheets of brik or phyllo dough
instructions: In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until soft.
Add the tuna, capers, parsley, salt, and pepper, and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Crack an egg into a small bowl and set aside.
Place one sheet of brik on a flat surface and brush with a little olive oil.
Place a tablespoon of the tuna mixture in the center of the sheet.
Make a well in the center of the mixture and carefully pour the egg into it.
Fold the corners of the sheet up to enclose the filling and create a square packet.
Repeat with the remaining sheets of brik and filling.
In a large skillet, heat about 1/2 inch of vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Fry each brik for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate and serve hot.

recipes.name: Fa'ausi
recipes.description: A traditional Samoan dessert made with coconut milk and brown sugar.
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the coconut milk, brown sugar, and water.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Lu'au
recipes.description: A traditional Samoan dish made with taro leaves and coconut cream.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the coconut milk and water to a simmer over medium-high heat.
Add the taro leaves, onion, and salt to the pot and stir gently to combine.
Cover the pot and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the leaves are tender and the mixture has thickened.
Serve hot, garnished with additional coconut cream if desired.

recipes.name: Kokolo
recipes.description: A spicy Samoan dish made with fish, tomatoes, and chili peppers.
ingredients: 2 pounds fish fillets, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the fish, onion, tomatoes, and chili peppers.
Add the lemon juice, coconut cream, salt, and pepper to the bowl and stir gently to combine.
Cover the bowl and let marinate in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Transfer the fish mixture to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Trinxat
recipes.description: A traditional Andorran dish made with cabbage, potatoes, and bacon.
instructions: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the cabbage and potatoes for 15 minutes or until tender.
Drain well and mash the vegetables until smooth.
In a large skillet, cook the bacon until crisp.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the mashed vegetables and chicken broth to the skillet and cook over medium heat until heated through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Drizzle with olive oil before serving.

recipes.name: Coca
recipes.description: A savory Andorran pastry made with a flaky crust and filled with meat, vegetables, and cheese.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cold butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, butter, water, and salt. Mix until a dough forms.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes.
In a large skillet, cook the ground meat until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Add the onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook until softened.
Stir in the frozen peas and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface and place it in a greased baking dish.
Spread the meat and vegetable mixture over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top of the filling.
Fold the edges of the dough over the filling and brush with the beaten egg.
Bake at 375°F for 35-40 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Calulu de Peixe
recipes.description: A traditional Angolan fish stew made with palm oil, okra, and spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs fish fillets (tilapia, cod, or other white fish), cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot, heat the palm oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the fish and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the okra, tomatoes, water or fish stock, salt, black pepper, paprika, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the okra is tender.
Serve hot over rice or with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Muamba de Galinha
recipes.description: A spicy chicken stew made with peanut butter, vegetables, and spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken pieces (legs, thighs, or breasts)
2 cups chopped vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, sweet potatoes, or others)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the palm oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the peanut butter, tomatoes, water or chicken stock, chopped vegetables, salt, black pepper, paprika, bay leaf, and cayenne pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot over rice or with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Crayfish Stew
recipes.description: A delicious stew made with fresh crayfish and vegetables.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until soft and translucent.
Add the garlic, bell peppers, and tomatoes. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
Add the crayfish, thyme, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the crayfish are cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Johnny Cakes
recipes.description: A simple and delicious cornmeal flatbread.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the cornmeal, salt, and sugar.
Add the water and stir until a dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for a few minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and shape them into flat rounds.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry the Johnny Cakes for a few minutes on each side, until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Fungee and Saltfish
recipes.description: A traditional Antiguan breakfast dish made with cornmeal and salt cod.
ingredients: 1/2 pound salt cod, soaked overnight and shredded
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the cornmeal, salt, and water.
In a medium skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the salt cod to the skillet and cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour the cornmeal mixture into the skillet and stir to combine with the salt cod and vegetables.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, for 15-20 minutes, or until the mixture has thickened and the cornmeal is cooked through.
Serve hot with hot pepper sauce.

recipes.name: Curried Goat
recipes.description: A flavorful Antiguan dish made with goat meat and spices.
ingredients: 2 pounds goat meat, cut into bite-size pieces
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the goat meat to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.
Stir in the curry powder, allspice, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cayenne pepper.
Add the water to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the goat meat is tender and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the salt and serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Empanadas
recipes.description: A savory pastry filled with seasoned ground beef, olives, onions, and spices.
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it up with a wooden spoon.
Add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
Stir in the chopped olives, paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the empanada dough rounds to about 5 inches in diameter.
Place a spoonful of the beef filling in the center of each round.
Fold the dough in half and pinch the edges together to seal.
Brush the empanadas with the beaten egg.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Milanesa
recipes.description: A breaded and fried beef cutlet similar to schnitzel.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°F (95°C).
In a shallow dish, mix together the breadcrumbs, flour, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Dip each beef cutlet into the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry the cutlets for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Transfer the cutlets to a baking sheet and keep warm in the oven until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Khorovats
recipes.description: Armenian grilled meat skewers
instructions: Cut meat into 1 inch cubes.
In a large bowl, combine meat, onions, olive oil, vinegar, salt, black pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Mix well and let marinate in the fridge for at least 2 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Thread meat onto skewers.
Grill skewers for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, or until meat is cooked through.
Serve hot with pita bread, sliced tomatoes, and cucumbers.

recipes.name: Lavash
recipes.description: Traditional Armenian flatbread
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, salt, sugar, and yeast.
Gradually add warm water and stir until a dough forms.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface for 5-10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl and cover with a towel. Let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 500°F.
Divide dough into 8-10 pieces and roll each piece into a thin circle on a lightly floured surface.
Place circles of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 3-5 minutes, or until bread is puffed and lightly browned.
Remove from oven and let cool on a wire rack.
Serve with hummus, baba ganoush, or any other dip.

recipes.name: Keshi Yena
recipes.description: A popular Aruban dish made with chicken, cheese, and other ingredients.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a large pan, sauté the onion, bell peppers, and garlic until tender.
Add the tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, ketchup, raisins, and olives. Stir to combine.
Add the cooked chicken and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
In a separate bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, shredded cheese, and milk.
Grease a baking dish with butter or oil.
Layer the chicken mixture and bread crumb mixture in the baking dish, starting with a layer of chicken and ending with a layer of bread crumbs.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Pastechi
recipes.description: A traditional Aruban snack made with dough filled with cheese or meat.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cold butter, cut into small pieces
1/2 pound gouda cheese or ground beef
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and sugar.
Using a pastry blender or your fingers, cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add the water, a little at a time, until the dough comes together and forms a ball.
Cover the dough and let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
On a floured surface, roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness.
Using a circular cookie cutter or a glass, cut out circles of dough.
Place a tablespoon of grated gouda cheese or a spoonful of ground beef in the center of each circle.
Fold the dough over the filling to form a half-moon shape and press the edges together to seal.
Brush the pastechi with beaten egg and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Meat Pie
recipes.description: A classic Australian dish consisting of a pastry shell filled with savory minced meat.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Stir in the tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, flour, thyme, rosemary, salt, and black pepper.
Gradually stir in the beef broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5-10 minutes or until the mixture has thickened.
Roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface and cut it into 4 equal squares.
Divide the meat mixture among the squares, placing it in the center of each one.
Fold the pastry over the filling to create a triangle shape, pressing the edges to seal.
Brush the tops of the pies with the beaten egg and cut a small slit in the center of each one to allow steam to escape.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and puffed up.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Lamingtons
recipes.description: A classic Australian dessert consisting of sponge cake coated in chocolate and coconut.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk, until the batter is smooth and well combined.
Stir in the vanilla extract.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely in the pan before cutting into 24 squares.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and hot water until smooth.
Place the shredded coconut in a shallow dish.
Dip each square of cake into the chocolate mixture, using a fork to turn it over and coat all sides.
Use the fork to lift the cake out of the chocolate and let any excess drip off.
Roll the cake in the shredded coconut until well coated.
Place the finished lamingtons on a wire rack to set.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Wiener Schnitzel
recipes.description: A classic Austrian dish consisting of breaded and fried veal cutlets.
instructions: Pound the veal cutlets to an even thickness, about 1/4 inch.
Season the cutlets with salt and pepper.
Place the flour in a shallow dish, the beaten eggs in another dish, and the breadcrumbs in a third dish.
Dredge each cutlet in the flour, shaking off any excess, then dip in the egg, and coat with breadcrumbs.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the cutlets and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate and serve hot with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Apfelstrudel
recipes.description: A sweet Austrian pastry filled with apples, cinnamon, and raisins.
ingredients: 3 large apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix together the breadcrumbs, sugar, and cinnamon in a small bowl.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced apples with the breadcrumb mixture, raisins, and slivered almonds.
Lay one sheet of phyllo dough on a clean work surface and brush with melted butter. Repeat with remaining phyllo sheets.
Spread the apple mixture over the phyllo stack, leaving a 2-inch border on all sides.
Fold the edges of the phyllo over the filling and roll up tightly.
Transfer the strudel to the prepared baking sheet, seam side down.
Brush the top of the strudel with melted butter and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Plov
recipes.description: Azerbaijani version of pilaf made with lamb or beef, rice, and vegetables.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until translucent.
Add the meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the rice, grated carrots, cumin, coriander, paprika, and salt. Stir to combine.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Dolma
recipes.description: Azerbaijani dish made of stuffed grape leaves or vegetables, typically with a mixture of rice and meat.
ingredients: 1 jar preserved grape leaves, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground meat, onion, rice, parsley, mint, dill, salt, and pepper.
Gently separate the grape leaves and rinse them under cold water.
Place a grape leaf on a flat surface, shiny side down, with the stem facing you.
Place a tablespoon of the meat mixture near the stem of the grape leaf.
Fold the bottom of the leaf over the filling, then fold in the sides, and roll up tightly to form a small packet.
Repeat with the remaining grape leaves and filling.
In a large pot, arrange the dolmas in a single layer.
Add the water and enough oil to cover the dolmas.
Place a plate or lid on top of the dolmas to weigh them down.
Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the rice and meat are cooked through and the grape leaves are tender.
Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Bahamian Conch Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing and light seafood salad made with fresh conch and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 lb. fresh conch, cleaned and chopped
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chopped conch, tomatoes, green pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, hot sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the conch mixture and toss to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until ready to serve.
Just before serving, stir in the diced avocado, if desired.

recipes.name: Bahamian Peas and Rice
recipes.description: A staple dish in Bahamian cuisine made with pigeon peas and rice, seasoned with herbs and spices.
ingredients: 1 lb. dried pigeon peas, soaked overnight and drained
instructions: In a large pot, combine the soaked pigeon peas and water. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 30 minutes.
Add the rice, onion, garlic, olive oil, thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the pot. Stir to combine.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: Machboos
recipes.description: A Bahraini spiced rice dish with chicken or lamb, served with a side of tomato and cucumber salad.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened.
Add the meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, baharat spice blend, turmeric, cumin, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, black pepper, and salt to taste. Stir to combine.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the meat is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Meanwhile, wash the rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Drain the rice and set aside.
When the meat is almost done, add the rice to the pot and stir to combine.
Add more water if needed to cover the rice. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot with a side of tomato and cucumber salad.

recipes.name: Khubz
recipes.description: A Bahraini flatbread made with flour, water, and yeast.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, yeast, and salt.
Add the warm water and stir until a dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for 10-15 minutes, or until the dough is smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl and cover with a damp cloth. Let rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 500°F (260°C).
Divide the dough into 8-10 equal pieces and roll each piece into a circle about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm) thick.
Place the dough circles on a baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until puffed and lightly browned.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.description: A popular mixed rice dish with meat, vegetables, and aromatic spices.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken or beef, cut into pieces
2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, peas, etc.)
instructions: Wash and soak the rice for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until golden brown.
Add the meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and mixed vegetables. Stir well and cook for a few minutes.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, turmeric powder, bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, and salt. Mix well.
Add the soaked rice and fry for a few minutes, stirring constantly.
Add yogurt and water. Stir well and bring to a boil.
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed, about 20-25 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Fish Curry
recipes.description: A spicy and tangy fish dish cooked in a tomato-based curry.
ingredients: 1 lb fish (rohu, catfish, tilapia, or any firm white fish), cut into pieces
A handful of chopped cilantro leaves
instructions: Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat. Add the onions and fry until golden brown.
Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chilies. Fry for a few minutes.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well and fry for a minute.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and mushy.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add the fish pieces and cook over medium heat until the fish is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Cou Cou and Flying Fish
recipes.description: A traditional Barbadian dish made with cornmeal and okra, served with flying fish.
ingredients: 1 pound flying fish, cleaned and deboned
instructions: In a large pot, bring the fish stock to a boil.
Add the onion, garlic, thyme, and scotch bonnet pepper to the pot and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
In a bowl, mix together the cornmeal and water to form a smooth paste.
Add the cornmeal mixture to the pot and stir constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture thickens and begins to pull away from the sides of the pot.
Add the butter and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
In a separate pan, fry the flying fish until golden brown on both sides.
Serve the cou cou hot with the fried flying fish on top.

recipes.name: Bajan Macaroni Pie
recipes.description: A delicious cheesy casserole made with macaroni, eggs, and milk.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the macaroni according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large pan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and bell peppers to the pan and cook until softened.
In a bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, thyme, oregano, paprika, black pepper, and salt.
Add the cooked macaroni and grated cheese to the bowl and stir to combine.
Add the cooked vegetables to the bowl and stir again.
Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown on top and set in the center.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Drachena
recipes.description: A hearty meat and potato stew, perfect for cold winter days.
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the onions, carrots, and parsnips to the pot and cook until the vegetables are softened.
Add the tomato paste, salt, pepper, bay leaves, thyme, and marjoram to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the beef broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the beef is tender.
Add the potatoes and cabbage to the pot and continue to simmer for another 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Remove the bay leaves before serving.

recipes.name: Drushki
recipes.description: Fried potato pancakes made with grated potatoes, onions, and flour.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the grated potatoes and onion.
Add the flour, egg, salt, and pepper to the bowl and mix until well combined.
In a large skillet or griddle, heat about 1/4 inch of oil over medium-high heat.
Using a large spoon or ladle, scoop about 1/4 cup of the potato mixture into the hot oil and flatten slightly with the back of the spoon.
Repeat to make several more pancakes, being careful not to overcrowd the skillet.
Fry the pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the pancakes from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
Repeat with the remaining potato mixture.
Serve the pancakes hot with your favorite toppings, such as sour cream, applesauce, or bacon.

recipes.name: Moules-frites
recipes.description: A traditional Belgian dish of steamed mussels and french fries.
ingredients: 2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cut into fries
instructions: In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft.
Add the mussels, white wine, and chicken broth.
Cover the pot and cook until the mussels have opened, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the mussels from the pot and keep warm.
Add the cream to the pot and simmer until the sauce has thickened slightly, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the parsley, chives, salt, and pepper.
Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F.
Add the potato fries and cook until golden brown, about 4-6 minutes.
Drain the fries on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
Serve the mussels with the sauce and the fries on the side.

recipes.name: Carbonnade flamande
recipes.description: A Belgian beef stew made with beer and served with crusty bread.
ingredients: 3 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into 2-inch cubes
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Season the beef with salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium-high heat.
Add the beef in batches and brown on all sides. Set aside.
Add the onions and garlic to the pot and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the flour over the onions and stir to combine.
Add the beer, beef broth, brown sugar, bay leaves, and thyme.
Return the beef to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and transfer to the oven.
Bake for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender.
Remove the pot from the oven and discard the bay leaves and thyme.
Serve the beef stew with slices of crusty bread on the side.

recipes.name: Stewed Chicken with Rice and Beans
recipes.description: A classic Belizean dish made with chicken cooked in a rich tomato-based sauce and served with rice and beans.
ingredients: 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, tomatoes, and bell pepper to the pot and cook until softened.
Stir in the tomato paste, water, thyme, oregano, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Return the chicken to the pot and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 45-60 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
In a separate pot, combine the rice, water, and salt and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 18-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
Stir in the kidney beans and serve the stewed chicken over the rice and beans.

recipes.name: Fry Jacks
recipes.description: A popular Belizean breakfast dish made of fried dough served with honey or jam.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the water and stir until a dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into small pieces and shape into balls.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F.
Flatten each ball of dough with your hands to form a thin disc.
Fry the dough discs in the hot oil until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes per side.
Drain the fry jacks on paper towels.
Serve the fry jacks hot with honey or jam.

recipes.name: Kuli Kuli
recipes.description: A popular snack food in Benin made from peanuts.
instructions: Grind the roasted peanuts in a food processor until they are finely ground.
Add the ground ginger, cayenne pepper, salt, and water to the peanut mixture and knead it together with your hands until it forms a firm dough.
Form the dough into small balls or cylinder shapes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a large pot over medium heat.
Fry the kuli kuli in the hot oil until they are golden brown and crispy, about 3-5 minutes.
Drain the kuli kuli on paper towels and allow them to cool before serving.

recipes.name: Fish Chowder
recipes.description: A traditional Bermudian soup made with fish, vegetables, and spices.
ingredients: 1 lb firm white fish fillets, such as cod or haddock
Lemon wedges and chopped parsley, for serving
instructions: Cut the fish into 1-inch cubes and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion, bell peppers, celery, and garlic and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, cumin, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the bay leaves, fish or chicken broth, diced tomatoes, and sherry.
Bring the soup to a simmer and cook for 20-30 minutes.
Add the fish cubes and cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the fish chowder hot, garnished with lemon wedges and chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Bermuda Fish Sandwich
recipes.description: A classic Bermudian sandwich made with fried fish and traditional condiments.
ingredients: 1 lb firm white fish fillets, such as cod or haddock
instructions: Cut the fish into 2-inch wide strips.
In a shallow dish, mix together the flour, cornmeal, salt, and cayenne pepper.
Coat the fish strips in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the fish strips to the skillet and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove the fish from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
Toast the hamburger buns.
In a small bowl, mix together the tartar sauce, ketchup, and mayonnaise.
Spread the sauce on the bottom half of each bun.
Top with a lettuce leaf, a slice of tomato, and the fried fish strips.
Drizzle with hot sauce to taste, if desired, and top with the other half of the bun.
Serve the Bermuda fish sandwich hot.

recipes.name: Ema datshi
recipes.description: A spicy Bhutanese dish made with chili peppers and cheese.
ingredients: 6-8 fresh green chili peppers, stemmed and sliced
1/2 cup crumbled Bhutanese cheese (or substitute feta or queso fresco)
instructions: In a large pan or wok, sauté the chili peppers, garlic, and onion over medium heat until the onion is translucent.
Add the tomato, salt, and turmeric and continue cooking until the tomato has softened.
Add the water and bring to a simmer.
Add the crumbled cheese and stir until it has melted and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Jasha maroo
recipes.description: A Bhutanese chicken dish with ginger, garlic, and chili peppers.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
3-4 fresh red chili peppers, stemmed and sliced
instructions: In a large pan or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and stir-fry until lightly browned.
Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and chili peppers and continue cooking until the onion is translucent.
Add the salt, turmeric, and water and bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Salteñas
recipes.description: A savory Bolivian pastry filled with beef, vegetables, and spices.
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the onion, green onion, cilantro, potatoes, carrots, peas, red bell pepper, and garlic.
Cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the cumin, oregano, paprika, and cayenne pepper and stir to combine.
Pour in the beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Fill the empanada dough with the beef mixture and seal the edges.
Place the salteñas on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Pique a lo macho
recipes.description: A hearty Bolivian dish of sautéed beef, onions, and peppers topped with a spicy sauce and served with boiled potatoes.
instructions: Season the beef with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
Add the onion, red and green bell peppers, and garlic to the skillet and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, cumin, oregano, and paprika and stir to combine.
Pour in the beef broth and bring to a simmer.
Add the beef back to the skillet and stir to combine.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the white vinegar, parsley, and cilantro.
Serve the beef mixture

recipes.name: Cevapi
recipes.description: A popular grilled dish of minced meat served with flatbread and onions.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, ground lamb, baking soda, salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and water.
Form the mixture into small sausage-shaped pieces, about 3-4 inches long.
Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Grill the cevapi for 5-6 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through.
Serve the cevapi with flatbread or pita bread and sliced onions.

recipes.name: Burek
recipes.description: A savory pastry filled with meat and vegetables.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, onion, salt, black pepper, paprika, cayenne pepper, ground cumin, ground coriander, and water.
In a separate bowl, mix together the sour cream, yogurt, and feta cheese.
Unroll the phyllo dough and brush each sheet with melted butter.
Place a layer of the phyllo dough in a baking dish, letting the edges hang over the sides of the dish.
Spread a layer of the meat mixture over the phyllo dough.
Spread a layer of the sour cream mixture over the meat.
Repeat with additional layers of phyllo dough, meat mixture, and sour cream mixture, until all ingredients are used.
Fold the overhanging edges of the phyllo dough over the top of the burek.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the phyllo dough is golden brown and crispy.
Allow the burek to cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Seswaa
recipes.description: A traditional Botswanan meat stew made with beef and served with maize porridge.
instructions: In a large pot, combine the beef, onion, garlic, and water.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is very tender.
Remove the beef from the pot and shred with a fork.
Return the beef to the pot and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with maize porridge.

recipes.name: Seswaa Dip
recipes.description: A flavorful Botswanan dip made with beef and served with crackers or bread.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the shredded beef, onion, garlic, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, hot sauce, and beef broth.
Mix well and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve cold with crackers or bread.

recipes.name: Feijoada
recipes.description: A classic Brazilian stew made with black beans, beef, and pork.
ingredients: 1 pound beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
1/2 pound pork shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Rinse the black beans and place them in a large pot. Add enough water to cover the beans by 2 inches.
Bring the beans to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour.
Add the beef, pork, sausage, bacon, onion, garlic, bay leaves, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper to the pot.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients by 1 inch. Bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 hours, or until the beans and meats are tender.
Remove the bay leaves and discard. Serve the feijoada with white rice and orange slices. Garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Pão de Queijo
recipes.description: A popular Brazilian cheese bread made with tapioca flour.
ingredients: 1 cup grated cheese (such as Parmesan or cheddar)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a medium saucepan, combine the tapioca flour, vegetable oil, milk, and salt.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture forms a ball and pulls away from the sides of the pan, about 5 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
Add the egg and mix until smooth.
Stir in the grated cheese.
Scoop tablespoon-sized balls of the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, leaving about 2 inches between each ball.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the pão de queijo are puffed and golden brown.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Banitsa
recipes.description: A traditional Bulgarian pastry filled with cheese and eggs.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Mix together the feta cheese, eggs, yogurt, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Layer 6 sheets of phyllo dough in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish, brushing each sheet with melted butter.
Spread half of the cheese mixture on top of the phyllo dough.
Layer another 6 sheets of phyllo dough on top of the cheese mixture, brushing each sheet with melted butter.
Spread the remaining cheese mixture on top of the phyllo dough.
Layer the remaining 6 sheets of phyllo dough on top of the cheese mixture, brushing each sheet with melted butter.
Brush the top of the banitsa with melted butter.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Shopska salad
recipes.description: A fresh and colorful Bulgarian salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, onions, and feta cheese.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, cucumbers, green pepper, and red onion.
Add the crumbled feta cheese and toss to combine.
Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle chopped fresh parsley on top and serve.

recipes.name: Riz Gras (Jollof Rice)
recipes.description: A flavorful one-pot rice dish made with vegetables, tomato paste, and spices.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil.
Add the chicken broth, tomato paste, bell peppers, jalapeno pepper, smoked paprika, cumin, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork and garnish with cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Poulet Bicyclette (Grilled Chicken)
recipes.description: A popular street food in Burkina Faso made with marinated chicken and grilled to perfection.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the vegetable oil, onion, garlic, lemon juice, soy sauce, ginger, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken and turn to coat well with the marinade.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Grill the chicken for 10-12 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over the chicken.

recipes.name: Beans and Plantains Stew
recipes.description: A hearty and comforting stew made with beans and plantains, often served with rice or bread.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft.
Add the tomato paste and stir to combine.
Add the beans, plantains, and water.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 45-60 minutes, or until the beans and plantains are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Brochettes
recipes.description: A popular street food in Burundi, brochettes are skewers of marinated and grilled meat, usually served with a spicy dipping sauce.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef or goat, cut into bite-sized pieces
Wooden skewers, soaked in water for at least 30 minutes
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the beef or goat, onions, garlic, paprika, cumin, coriander, salt, black pepper, vegetable oil, and red wine vinegar.
Cover the bowl and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Preheat the grill or a grill pan over high heat.
Thread the meat onto the wooden skewers.
Grill the skewers for 3-4 minutes per side, or until the meat is cooked to your liking.
Serve hot with a spicy dipping sauce, if desired.

recipes.name: Amok Trey
recipes.description: A classic Cambodian dish of fish and spices steamed in a banana leaf.
ingredients: 1 lb white fish fillet, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a blender, combine coconut milk, egg, red curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, salt, and lime juice. Blend until smooth.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the scallions and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the fish to the skillet and cook until lightly browned, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the coconut milk mixture to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and stir in the cilantro.
Cut the banana leaf into 4 equal pieces. Place each piece on a flat surface and spoon a portion of the fish mixture onto each leaf.
Fold the sides of the leaf up and over the mixture to form a package, tucking the edges under to seal.
Place the packages in a steamer basket and steam for 15-20 minutes.
Remove from the steamer and let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.name: Bai Sach Chrouk
recipes.description: A popular Cambodian breakfast dish of grilled pork and rice.
ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder, sliced into thin strips
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, black pepper, and garlic.
Add the pork to the bowl and toss to coat with the marinade. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush the grill with vegetable oil.
Remove the pork from the marinade and grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Divide the rice among four plates. Top each plate with the grilled pork, sliced cucumber, scallions, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Ndolé
recipes.description: A stew made with bitter leaves, peanuts, and either fish, beef, or chicken.
ingredients: 1 pound beef, chicken, or fish, cut into small pieces
instructions: Wash the bitter leaves in cold water and chop them finely.
In a large pot, sauté the onion and garlic in the vegetable oil until softened.
Add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the peanut butter and 2 cups of water and stir well to combine.
Add the bitter leaves and the meat or fish and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the meat or fish is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with boiled plantains or rice.

recipes.name: Suya
recipes.description: A spicy grilled meat dish served with onions and tomatoes.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef or chicken, cut into thin strips
instructions: In a bowl, combine the groundnut oil, ginger, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper.
Add the meat strips to the bowl and toss to coat with the spice mixture.
Thread the meat onto skewers and grill over medium-high heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve hot with chopped onions and tomatoes.

recipes.name: Poutine
recipes.description: A Canadian dish made with french fries, cheese curds, and gravy.
ingredients: 2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cut into fries
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°F.
In a large pot, heat the oil to 325°F.
Add the potato fries and cook until soft, but not brown, about 4-5 minutes.
Remove the fries from the pot and drain on paper towels.
Increase the oil temperature to 375°F.
Add the fries back to the pot and cook until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Remove the fries from the pot and drain on paper towels.
In a large saucepan, heat the beef gravy over low heat.
Divide the fries among serving plates.
Top the fries with the cheese curds and pour the hot gravy over the top.
Place the plates in the oven to keep warm until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Maple-Glazed Salmon
recipes.description: A Canadian twist on salmon, made with a sweet and savory maple glaze.
instructions: Season the salmon with salt and pepper on both sides.
In a small bowl, whisk together the maple syrup, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the salmon fillets to the skillet, skin side down.
Cook for 4-5 minutes, or until the skin is crispy and the salmon is cooked halfway through.
Turn the salmon over and brush the top with the maple glaze.
Cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
Remove the salmon from the skillet and drizzle with the remaining glaze.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cachupa
recipes.description: A slow-cooked stew made with corn, beans, and meat or fish.
ingredients: 1 pound beef or fish, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until soft.
Add the meat or fish and cook until browned.
Add the corn, beans, tomatoes, bay leaves, and enough water to cover the ingredients.
Bring the mixture to a boil and then reduce the heat to low.
Simmer the stew for about 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with bread.

recipes.name: Pastel
recipes.description: A popular Cape Verdean street food made with a filling of tuna or chicken, wrapped in dough, and fried.
ingredients: 1 can of tuna or 1 pound of chicken breast, cooked and shredded
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until soft.
Add the tuna or chicken, tomatoes, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Set aside the filling and let it cool.
In a bowl, combine the flour and water to form a dough.
Roll the dough into small balls and flatten them into circles.
Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each circle.
Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges to seal.
In a deep fryer or large pot, heat the vegetable oil to 375°F.
Fry the pastels until golden brown, about 3-5 minutes.
Remove the pastels from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Cayman-style turtle stew
recipes.description: A traditional stew made with turtle meat and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 lbs turtle meat, cut into cubes
1 scotch bonnet pepper, seeded and minced
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the turtle meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, garlic, and scotch bonnet pepper.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft.
Stir in the tomato paste, fish or chicken broth, water, thyme, bay leaves, salt, and pepper.
Bring the stew to a simmer and cook for 1-2 hours, or until the turtle meat is tender.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Conch fritters
recipes.description: A popular appetizer made with conch meat, flour, and spices.
ingredients: 1 lb conch meat, cleaned and minced
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, and cayenne pepper.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, water, and egg.
Stir the conch meat, chopped onion, green bell pepper, and red bell pepper into the flour mixture.
Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir until well combined.
In a deep fryer or large pot, heat the vegetable oil to 375°F.
Using a spoon or small scoop, drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Remove the fritters from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with tartar sauce or hot sauce.

recipes.name: Kanda ti nyma
recipes.description: A spicy beef stew made with peanut butter and served over rice.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
Chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro for garnish
instructions: Season the beef with salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beef in batches and brown on all sides. Set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, paprika, and cayenne pepper to the pot.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and the spices are fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the beef broth, peanut butter, and tomato paste to the pot and whisk until smooth.
Return the beef to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and cook over low heat until the beef is tender, about 2-3 hours.
Serve the beef stew over cooked rice, garnished with chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Brochettes
recipes.description: Skewered and grilled meat marinated in a spicy peanut sauce.
ingredients: 1 pound beef or chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
instructions: Season the meat with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, lime juice, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and cayenne pepper.
Add the meat to the bowl and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the peanut butter, coconut milk, honey, rice vinegar, and sriracha sauce.
Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until the sauce is smooth and heated through, about 5 minutes.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Thread the meat onto the bamboo skewers, discarding any excess marinade.
Grill the skewers, turning occasionally, until the meat is cooked through and charred in spots, about 8-10 minutes.
Serve the skewers with the spicy peanut sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Djiboutilou
recipes.description: A hearty and flavorful stew made with lamb, vegetables, and African spices.
ingredients: 2 pounds lamb stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Season the lamb with salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the lamb in batches and brown on all sides. Set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, and tomatoes to the pot and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato paste, cumin, coriander, ginger, paprika, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper to the pot and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Return the lamb to the pot and add enough water or lamb broth to cover the meat. Bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and cook over low heat for about 1 hour, until the lamb is tender.
Add the potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper to the pot and cook for another 20-30 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
Stir in the chopped parsley and serve the stew over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Pastel de Choclo
recipes.description: A savory pie made with ground beef, onions, and corn.
ingredients: 4 cups fresh corn kernels (about 6 ears of corn)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a blender or food processor, puree the corn with the milk and sugar until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the ground beef, garlic, paprika, cumin, oregano, raisins, and olives to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the beef is browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Spread the beef mixture in the bottom of a 9-inch baking dish. Top with the sliced eggs.
Pour the corn mixture over the beef and eggs.
In a small bowl, mix together the flour, butter, and Parmesan cheese until crumbly. Sprinkle the mixture over the top of the corn.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is heated through.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.description: A spicy stir-fry dish with chicken, peanuts, and vegetables, served over rice.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
In a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
Add the chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add the bell peppers and onion to the wok and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, Sichuan peppercorns, and red pepper flakes to the wok and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add the chicken back to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the roasted peanuts and green onions to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Serve the Kung Pao chicken over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Steamed Dumplings
recipes.description: Small parcels of meat and vegetables wrapped in thin dough and steamed, served with dipping sauce.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Chinese rice wine or dry sherry
Soy sauce and rice vinegar, for dipping
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground pork, soy sauce, rice wine or sherry, ginger, garlic, Sichuan peppercorns, salt, and sugar.
Add the chopped cabbage, scallions, and cilantro to the bowl and mix well.
Fill a small bowl with water and set it next to your work surface.
To assemble the dumplings, place a wrapper in the palm of your hand and add a small spoonful of filling to the center.
Dip your finger in the bowl of water and moisten the edges of the wrapper.
Fold the wrapper in half, pinching the edges together to seal.
Pleat the edges of the wrapper, if desired.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Arrange the dumplings in a steamer basket lined with parchment paper.
Fill a wok or pot with water and bring to a boil.
Set the steamer basket over the water and steam the dumplings for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
Serve Hot

recipes.name: Crab and Coconut Curry
recipes.description: A delicious and fragrant crab curry with coconut milk.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder and sauté for another minute.
Add the crab meat to the pan and sauté until slightly browned, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the coconut milk, water, salt, and sugar to the pan and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the sauce has thickened and the crab is fully cooked.
Stir in the lime juice and cilantro and serve hot over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Christmas Island Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing and colorful salad with tropical flavors.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the salad greens, pineapple, papaya, mango, cilantro, and red onion.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the lime juice, honey, olive oil, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Coconut crab curry
recipes.description: A delicious and fragrant curry made with fresh coconut meat and local spices, served with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 large coconut crab, cleaned and cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, paprika, and cayenne pepper to the pot and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the coconut crab pieces to the pot and stir to coat with the spice mixture.
Add the coconut milk and grated coconut meat to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat until the crab is cooked through and tender, about 20-30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the curry over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Fish and coconut milk soup
recipes.description: A light and flavorful soup made with fresh fish, coconut milk, and aromatic herbs and spices.
ingredients: 2 pounds fresh fish fillets, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Season the fish with salt and pepper.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and cayenne pepper to the pot and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the fish to the pot and stir to coat with the spice mixture.
Add the fish stock or water to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat until the fish is cooked through and tender, about 10-15 minutes.
Add the coconut milk to the pot and stir to combine.
Stir in the cilantro and lime juice.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the soup over steamed rice

recipes.name: Ajiaco
recipes.description: A hearty soup made with chicken, three types of potatoes, and corn.
ingredients: 3 ears of corn, cut into thirds
1 pound yellow potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 pound red potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 pound russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the chicken broth, water, corn, and potatoes to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.
Add the cilantro, salt, and pepper to the pot.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve the soup hot, garnished with avocado slices, capers, and a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.name: Bandeja Paisa
recipes.description: A traditional Colombian dish consisting of grilled steak, beans, rice, fried egg, and plantains.
instructions: Season the flank steak with cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the steak and cook until browned on both sides and cooked to your desired level of doneness.
In a separate skillet, heat a little more oil over medium-high heat.
Add the plantains and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Assemble the dish by placing the cooked rice on a plate and topping it with the cooked steak, beans, fried egg, plantains, bacon, and chorizo sausage.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Langouste a la Vanille
recipes.description: A rich and flavorful lobster dish made with vanilla and served over rice.
ingredients: 4 lobster tails, cleaned and halved lengthwise
instructions: Season the lobster with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil and butter over medium-high heat.
Add the lobster and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove the lobster from the skillet and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the seafood stock and vanilla bean to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Return the lobster to the skillet and cover with the sauce.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer until the lobster is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and lemon juice and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes.
Serve the lobster over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Mataba
recipes.description: A delicious and comforting dish made with cassava leaves and coconut milk.
ingredients: 2 pounds cassava leaves, washed and chopped
instructions: In a large pot, combine the cassava leaves, chicken or vegetable broth, onion, garlic, and ginger.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer until the cassava leaves are tender, about 30 minutes.
In a separate skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the cooked cassava leaves to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 15 minutes.
Stir in the coconut milk and cook until the mixture has thickened, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the mataba over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Moambe chicken
recipes.description: A chicken stew with tomato, onions and palm butter.
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken pieces in batches and brown on all sides. Set aside.
Add the onions, garlic, and ginger to the pot and cook until the onions are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes, until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the chicken broth and palm butter to the pot and whisk until smooth.
Return the chicken to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and cook over low heat until the chicken is tender, about 45-60 minutes.
Serve the chicken stew over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Fumbwa
recipes.description: A traditional Congolese side dish made with cassava leaves, peanuts, and spices.
ingredients: 2 pounds fresh cassava leaves, washed and chopped
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the palm oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pot and cook until the onions are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes, until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cassava leaves, peanuts, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and water to the pot.
Stir to combine, then bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and cook over low heat until the cassava leaves are tender, about 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve the fumbwa as a side dish.

recipes.name: Poulet Yassa
recipes.description: A flavorful chicken dish with a tangy lemon marinade and caramelized onions.
ingredients: 2-3 pounds chicken, cut into serving pieces
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper and place in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, onions, vegetable oil, Dijon mustard, garlic, cayenne pepper, and bay leaves.
Pour the marinade over the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off any excess. Place the chicken in a baking dish and pour the marinade over the top.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the onions are caramelized.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Foufou
recipes.description: A starchy staple dish made from cassava root or plantains, often served with a meat or vegetable stew.
ingredients: Meat or vegetable stew for serving
instructions: Peel the cassava root or plantains and cut into large chunks.
Place the chunks in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until the cassava root or plantains are soft and tender, about 30-40 minutes.
Drain the cassava root or plantains and transfer to a large bowl.
Mash the cassava root or plantains with a potato masher or the back of a spoon until smooth.
Add salt to taste and continue mashing until well combined.
Serve the foufou with a meat or vegetable stew.

recipes.name: Ika Mata
recipes.description: A refreshing dish made with raw fish marinated in coconut milk, lime juice, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 pound fresh fish, such as mahi-mahi or tuna, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 red chili pepper, seeded and finely chopped
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the fish, coconut milk, lime juice, red onion, tomato, cucumber, and chili pepper.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours.
Serve chilled, garnished with fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Rukau
recipes.description: A traditional Cook Islands side dish made with taro leaves and coconut cream.
instructions: Wash the taro leaves and remove the tough stems.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Blanch the taro leaves in the boiling water for 5-7 minutes, until tender.
Drain the taro leaves and chop them finely.
In a large saucepan, heat the coconut cream over medium heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the pan and cook until the onion is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the chopped taro leaves to the pan and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the mixture is thickened and creamy.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.name: Gallo Pinto
recipes.description: A classic Costa Rican dish made with rice and beans, often served for breakfast.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Lizano sauce or Worcestershire sauce
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion, red bell pepper, garlic, cumin, and salt to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the cooked rice and black beans to the skillet and stir to combine.
Stir in the Lizano sauce or Worcestershire sauce and cook until the rice and beans are heated through, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the chopped cilantro.
Serve the Gallo Pinto with fried or scrambled eggs and a dollop of sour cream, if desired.

recipes.name: Arroz con Pollo
recipes.description: A classic Costa Rican dish made with chicken, rice, and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
instructions: In a large Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper and add them to the Dutch oven.
Cook the chicken until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove the chicken from the Dutch oven and set aside.
Add the onion, red bell pepper, and garlic to the Dutch oven and cook until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the rice to the Dutch oven and stir to combine with the vegetables.
Add the chicken broth to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Return the chicken thighs to the Dutch oven and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the Dutch oven, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the frozen peas to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Cover the Dutch oven and continue to simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in the chopped cilantro.
Serve the Arroz con Pollo with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Kedjenou
recipes.description: A hearty stew made with chicken, vegetables, and spices, cooked in a tightly sealed pot.
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
In a large Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and brown on all sides. Set aside.
Add the onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, ginger, thyme, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, and bay leaves to the pot and cook for another 2 minutes.
Return the chicken to the pot and add the chicken broth. Bring to a simmer.
Add the carrots, potatoes, and plantains to the pot and stir to combine.
Cover the pot tightly with foil and then with a lid. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the chicken is tender and the vegetables are soft, about 1 1/2 hours.
Serve the kedjenou hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Pasticada
recipes.description: A Dalmatian specialty, this slow-cooked beef stew is flavored with prunes, bacon, and red wine.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot, heat 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Season the beef with salt and pepper, then add to the pot and sear on all sides until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add the bacon to the pot and cook until crispy. Remove and set aside with the beef.
Add the garlic, onion, carrot, and celery to the pot and cook until the vegetables are soft and lightly browned, about 10 minutes.

Deglaze the pot with the red wine, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom. Add the beef broth, red wine vinegar, tomato paste, prunes, bay leaves, rosemary, sugar, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Return the beef and bacon to the pot, making sure they are covered in the sauce. Bring to a simmer, then cover and transfer to the oven.
Cook for 3-4 hours, or until the beef is very tender and falling apart.

Remove the pot from the oven and let the stew cool for a few minutes. Remove the bay leaves and rosemary stems, then use a stick blender or transfer the stew to a blender to puree the sauce until smooth.
Serve the stew over mashed potatoes or gnocchi, garnished with fresh parsley or rosemary.

recipes.name: Ropa Vieja
recipes.description: A popular Cuban dish made with shredded beef, vegetables, and a tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Place the flank steak in a large pot and add enough water to cover it. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 2 hours or until the beef is very tender.
Remove the beef from the pot and let cool. Shred the beef into thin pieces and set aside.
In a large pan, heat some oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions, bell peppers, and garlic and sauté until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the bay leaves, cumin, oregano, salt, black pepper, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, and red wine to the pan. Stir to combine.
Add the shredded beef to the pan and stir to combine. Let the mixture simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the olives, raisins, and capers to the pan and stir to combine. Let simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve the Ropa Vieja over cooked white rice.

recipes.name: Halloumi cheese with watermelon
recipes.description: A refreshing and savory salad featuring the famous Cypriot cheese and sweet watermelon.
instructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Cut the halloumi cheese into 1/4-inch thick slices and add to the skillet.
Cook for 1-2 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.
In a large bowl, combine the watermelon, red onion, and mint leaves.
Add the cooked halloumi cheese to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Kleftiko
recipes.description: A delicious and hearty lamb dish that is slow cooked with potatoes and herbs.
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Season the lamb with salt and pepper.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, smoked paprika, cinnamon, cumin, and coriander.
Rub the mixture all over the lamb.
Place the lamb in a large roasting pan and pour the white wine around it.
Add the potatoes to the pan and pour the chicken broth over everything.
Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake for 2-3 hours, or until the lamb is tender and falls off the bone.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 20-30 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Svickova na smetane
recipes.description: A classic Czech beef dish in a creamy sauce, served with dumplings and cranberry sauce.
ingredients: Dumplings and cranberry sauce for serving
instructions: In a large Dutch oven, combine the beef, beef broth, onion, carrots, celery, bay leaf, allspice berries, and black peppercorns.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, for about 2 hours or until the beef is tender.
Remove the beef from the pot and set aside. Strain the vegetables and spices from the broth and reserve the broth.
In a small bowl, whisk together the heavy cream, sour cream, and flour.
In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the cream mixture and 1 cup of the reserved broth.
Bring to a simmer, whisking constantly, until the sauce thickens. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Slice the beef and serve with the sauce, dumplings, and cranberry sauce. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Knedliky
recipes.description: A Czech-style dumpling made with bread and served with meat dishes or as a side dish.
ingredients: 8 slices white bread, crusts removed and cut into cubes
instructions: In a large bowl, soak the bread cubes in the milk for 10 minutes.
Add the eggs, flour, melted butter, salt, and pepper to the bowl and mix well.
Divide the mixture into two equal parts and shape each into a log about 10 inches long and 3 inches in diameter.
Place the logs on a piece of cheesecloth and wrap tightly. Tie the ends with kitchen twine.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Carefully lower the wrapped dumplings into the pot and boil for 30-40 minutes.
Remove the dumplings from the pot and let cool slightly before unwrapping and slicing into rounds. Serve with meat dishes or as a side dish.

recipes.name: Frikadeller (Danish Meatballs)
recipes.description: Traditional Danish meatballs made with ground pork and served with boiled potatoes and red cabbage.
ingredients: Boiled potatoes and red cabbage, for serving
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, chopped onion, egg, breadcrumbs, milk, salt, black pepper, nutmeg, and allspice. Mix well.
Form the mixture into small meatballs, about 1-2 inches in diameter.
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the meatballs to the skillet and cook, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides and cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
Serve the meatballs with boiled potatoes and red cabbage.

recipes.name: Æbleskiver (Danish Pancake Balls)
recipes.description: Small, fluffy pancakes in the shape of balls, often filled with jam and dusted with powdered sugar.
ingredients: 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled
Jam and powdered sugar, for serving
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and granulated sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, milk, and melted butter.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and whisk until smooth.
In another bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the egg whites into the pancake batter until just combined.
Preheat an æbleskiver pan over medium heat and brush the wells with butter.
Fill each well with batter and cook until the edges are set and the bottom is golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Using a skewer or fork, gently turn the pancake balls over and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 2-3 minutes more.
Remove the pancake balls from the pan and repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve the æbleskiver with jam and powdered sugar.
