recipes.name: Sabaayad
recipes.description: Sabaayad is a flaky and chewy Somali flatbread that is typically served with tea or as a snack with honey or butter.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Add the warm milk and vegetable oil to the dry ingredients and mix well until a smooth dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball.
On a floured surface, roll each ball into a thin circle.
Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
Place one sabaayad on the skillet and cook until the bottom is lightly browned, about 1-2 minutes.
Flip the sabaayad and cook the other side for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Repeat with the remaining sabaayad.
Serve hot with tea or honey.

recipes.name: Callaloo Soup
recipes.description: A flavorful soup made with taro leaves and coconut milk, often served with bread or rice.
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add taro leaves and stir well to coat with the onion mixture.
Add chicken broth, coconut milk, thyme, black pepper, and salt to taste.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with bread or rice.

recipes.name: Baked Fish with Coconut Sauce
recipes.description: A simple but flavorful dish of baked fish topped with a rich coconut sauce.
ingredients: 4 fish fillets (such as snapper or mahi-mahi)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, mix together breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and salt to taste.
Brush fish fillets with olive oil and coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Place fish fillets in a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until fish is cooked through and the breadcrumbs are golden brown.
In a small saucepan, heat coconut milk over medium heat until simmering.
Pour coconut milk over baked fish and serve hot.

recipes.name: Sancocho
recipes.description: A hearty stew made with meat, vegetables, and spices, often served with rice or avocado.
ingredients: 2 lbs beef (or chicken), cut into cubes
1 lb yucca, peeled and cut into chunks
1 lb plantains, peeled and cut into chunks
1 lb potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and bell pepper and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add beef (or chicken) and brown on all sides.
Add yucca, plantains, potatoes, cilantro, oregano, cumin, salt, black pepper, and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or avocado.

recipes.name: Mangu
recipes.description: A classic Dominican breakfast dish made with mashed plantains and served with fried cheese, eggs, and salami.
instructions: Peel and cut plantains into chunks and boil in salted water until soft.
Drain the water and mash the plantains with a fork or masher.
Add milk, butter, and salt to taste, and mix well.
In a small pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add cheese slices and fry until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes per side.
In another small pan, cook eggs to your liking.
Serve the mashed plantains with fried cheese, eggs, and salami.

recipes.name: Locro de Papas
recipes.description: A thick and hearty potato soup made with cheese and avocado, typically served with popcorn on top.
ingredients: 1/2 lb cheese (queso fresco or feta), crumbled
instructions: In a large pot, heat butter over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add cumin, achiote powder, oregano, black pepper, and salt to taste, and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add potatoes, water, and milk, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Add crumbled cheese and cook until melted, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, topped with avocado slices, cilantro, and popcorn.

recipes.name: Ceviche
recipes.description: A popular seafood dish made with marinated shrimp or fish, onions, peppers, and lime juice.
ingredients: 1 lb shrimp or white fish, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a large bowl, combine shrimp (or fish), red onion, red and yellow bell peppers, cilantro, garlic, and jalapeño pepper.
Add lime juice, orange juice, salt, black pepper, and olive oil, and mix well.
Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until shrimp (or fish) is cooked through and opaque.
Serve cold, garnished with cilantro leaves and accompanied by plantain chips or toasted corn kernels.

recipes.name: Koshari
recipes.description: A popular street food dish made with rice, macaroni, lentils, and chickpeas, topped with a spicy tomato sauce and fried onions.
ingredients: 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, cook rice according to package instructions.
In a separate pot, cook macaroni according to package instructions.
In another pot, cook lentils until tender, about 20-25 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, about 15-20 minutes.
In a separate saucepan, combine diced tomatoes, garlic, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, black pepper, and salt to taste.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened.
To assemble the dish, mix together the cooked rice, macaroni, lentils, and chickpeas in a large bowl.
Serve hot, topped with the spicy tomato sauce and fried onions.

recipes.name: Ful Medames
recipes.description: A staple breakfast dish made with cooked fava beans, seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, and cumin, and typically served with bread.
ingredients: Chopped parsley and scallions for garnish
Pita bread or other bread for serving
instructions: Rinse the fava beans and soak them in water overnight.
Drain the beans and transfer them to a large pot with 6 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the beans are tender, about 2-3 hours.
Drain the beans and transfer them to a serving dish.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, salt, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the fava beans and mix well.
Garnish with chopped parsley and scallions.
Serve hot, with pita bread or other bread on the side.

recipes.name: Pupusas
recipes.description: A traditional Salvadoran dish consisting of a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, beans, or meat.
ingredients: 1/2 cup refried beans (or cooked and seasoned ground meat)
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the masa harina, warm water, and salt to make the dough.
Knead the dough for a few minutes until it is smooth and pliable.
Divide the dough into 8-10 equal portions and roll each one into a ball.
Flatten each ball with the palm of your hand to make a small disc, then place a spoonful of cheese and beans (or meat) in the center.
Gently fold the edges of the disc over the filling and roll it into a ball again.
Flatten the ball into a thick disc, about 1/2 inch thick.
Heat a griddle or a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and brush it with vegetable oil.
Cook the pupusas for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with a side of curtido (pickled cabbage salad) and salsa roja (red salsa).

recipes.name: Sopa de Pollo
recipes.description: A comforting chicken soup with vegetables and spices.
instructions: In a large pot, add the chicken, onion, garlic, carrots, celery, bell pepper, tomato, cilantro, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Cover with water and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Remove the chicken from the pot and shred the meat using a fork.
Return the shredded chicken to the pot and simmer for another 10-15 minutes.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve hot with a side of rice, avocado, and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Fufu de Ewondo
recipes.description: A staple dish made from plantains, cassava, and yams, usually served with a stew or soup.
instructions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Add the plantains, cassava, and yams, and boil until tender, about 25-30 minutes.
Drain the water and mash the vegetables with a fork or masher until smooth.
Add salt to taste and mix well.
Serve hot with a stew or soup of your choice.

recipes.name: Salsa Kribi
recipes.description: A spicy and tangy sauce made from chili peppers, onions, and vinegar, typically served with grilled or roasted meat.
ingredients: 10-15 fresh chili peppers, seeded and chopped
instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine the chili peppers, onion, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
Blend until smooth.
Transfer the sauce to a bowl and let it sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve as a condiment for grilled or roasted meat.

recipes.name: Zigni
recipes.description: A spicy stew made with beef or lamb and flavored with berbere spice.
ingredients: 1 lb beef or lamb, cut into small cubes
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add beef or lamb and brown on all sides.
Add berbere spice and tomato paste and mix well.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with injera (Ethiopian flatbread) or rice.

recipes.name: Timtimo
recipes.description: A spicy lentil stew made with berbere spice and vegetables.
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add carrot, potato, and tomato and sauté for a few minutes.
Add lentils, berbere spice, and water, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lentils and vegetables are tender.
Add salt to taste and mix well.
Serve hot with injera or bread.

recipes.name: Kartulipuder
recipes.description: A classic Estonian dish of mashed potatoes served with a variety of toppings.
ingredients: Toppings of your choice: fried bacon, fried onions, sausages, pickles, or lingonberry jam
instructions: Boil the potatoes in salted water until soft.
Drain the water and mash the potatoes with a fork or masher.
Add milk, butter, salt, and pepper to taste, and mix well.
Serve hot with your choice of toppings.

recipes.name: Kiluvõileib
recipes.description: An open-faced sandwich made with smoked sprats and other toppings.
instructions: Toast the rye bread slices.
Top each slice with smoked sprats and red onion slices.
Mix together sour cream and fresh dill, and spoon over the sprats.
Serve with a wedge of lemon on the side.

recipes.name: Emasi etinkhobe
recipes.description: A traditional Eswatini dish made with sour milk and maize meal.
instructions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Slowly add maize meal, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring frequently, for about 20 minutes.
Add sour milk and continue cooking for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and sugar to taste.
Serve hot as a porridge or as a side dish.

recipes.name: Sishwala
recipes.description: A traditional Eswatini side dish made with pumpkin and peanuts.
ingredients: 2 lbs pumpkin, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add pumpkin and water, cover, and cook until pumpkin is tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Using a fork or potato masher, mash the pumpkin until smooth.
Add chopped peanuts and stir to combine.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.name: Doro Wat
recipes.description: A spicy chicken stew that is the national dish of Ethiopia, often served with injera bread.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the niter kibbeh over medium heat.
Add the onions and sauté until they are soft and golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, berbere, and paprika and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Add the chicken and salt and stir to coat the chicken with the onion and spice mixture.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the chicken is cooked through and tender, about 45 minutes.
Add the hard-boiled eggs and continue to simmer for another 5-10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with injera bread.

recipes.name: Misir Wat
recipes.description: A spicy lentil stew that is a staple of Ethiopian cuisine, often served with injera bread.
ingredients: 1 cup red lentils, rinsed and drained
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, bring the lentils and water to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the lentils are tender and the water has been absorbed, about 20-25 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat the niter kibbeh over medium heat.
Add the onions and sauté until they are soft and golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Add the garlic, berbere, and paprika and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils, salt, and tomato to the onion and spice mixture, and stir to combine.
Simmer the mixture over low heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with injera bread.

recipes.name: Kokoda
recipes.description: A Fijian ceviche made with raw fish marinated in lime and coconut cream.
ingredients: 1 lb fresh fish fillet (mahi-mahi or snapper), cut into small cubes
1 green chili pepper, seeded and chopped
instructions: In a large bowl, combine fish and lime juice. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2-3 hours or until fish is opaque and firm.
Drain the lime juice and add coconut cream, onion, tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, chili pepper, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Refrigerate for 1 hour or until chilled.
Serve cold as an appetizer or light meal.

recipes.name: Lovo
recipes.description: A traditional Fijian dish of meat and vegetables cooked in an underground oven.
ingredients: 2 lbs meat (pork, chicken, or lamb), cut into serving pieces
instructions: Prepare the underground oven by digging a pit and filling it with hot stones.
Season the meat with salt and pepper and wrap it in banana leaves.
Layer the taro roots, sweet potatoes, and bananas on top of the meat. Add the corn on top.
Cover the whole thing with banana leaves and place it in the pit.
Cover the pit with dirt and let the food cook for 2-3 hours.
Remove the food from the pit and unwrap it from the banana leaves.
Serve hot as a main dish.

recipes.name: Karjalanpaisti
recipes.description: Karjalanpaisti is a traditional Finnish meat stew made with beef or pork and root vegetables. It is typically served with mashed potatoes or boiled potatoes and lingonberry jam.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs beef or pork, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add meat and brown on all sides.
Add flour, salt, and pepper and stir well.
Add broth, bay leaf, and vegetables.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the meat and vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with mashed potatoes or boiled potatoes and lingonberry jam.

recipes.name: Lihapullat (Finnish Meatballs)
recipes.description: Lihapullat are Finnish meatballs made with ground beef, breadcrumbs, and a mixture of milk and cream. They are typically served with mashed potatoes, lingonberry jam, and gravy.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, cream, egg, onion, salt, pepper, and allspice together.
Using your hands, shape the mixture into small meatballs.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add meatballs and brown on all sides.
Add flour and stir well to coat meatballs.
Add broth and bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the meatballs are cooked through and the gravy has thickened.
Serve hot with mashed potatoes, lingonberry jam, and gravy.

recipes.name: Boeuf Bourguignon
recipes.description: A classic French stew made with beef, red wine, and vegetables.
ingredients: 3 lbs beef chuck roast, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Remove bacon and set aside.
Add olive oil to the pot and increase heat to medium-high.
Add beef and brown on all sides.
Remove beef and set aside.
Add onions, carrots, and garlic to the pot and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add flour and stir until vegetables are coated.
Add red wine and beef broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Add bay leaves, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Return beef and bacon to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms until golden brown.
Add mushrooms to the pot and simmer for an additional 30 minutes.
Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Quiche Lorraine
recipes.description: A classic French tart made with eggs, cream, bacon, and cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large pan, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Remove bacon and set aside.
Add onion to the pan and sauté until translucent.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Add bacon, onion, and grated cheese to the bowl and mix well.
Pour mixture into the pie crust.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
Let cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Poulet Nyembwe
recipes.description: A popular chicken dish cooked in a spicy sauce made with ground nuts and palm oil.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the palm oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken pieces and brown on all sides, then remove from the pot and set aside.
Add the onions and garlic to the pot and sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add the water, ground peanuts, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, bay leaves, and thyme.
Stir well to combine, then add the chicken back to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with rice or fufu.

recipes.name: Poulet Moambé
recipes.description: Another popular chicken dish cooked in a sauce made with palm butter and served with cassava leaves.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh or frozen cassava leaves
instructions: In a large pot, heat the palm butter over medium heat.
Add the chicken pieces and brown on all sides, then remove from the pot and set aside.
Add the onions and garlic to the pot and sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add the water, cassava leaves, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, bay leaves, and thyme.
Stir well to combine, then add the chicken back to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with fufu or rice.

recipes.name: Domoda
recipes.description: A traditional Gambian dish made with peanut butter and served with rice.
instructions: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add beef and brown on all sides.
Add paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper and stir well.
Add peanut butter and water and stir until peanut butter is dissolved.
Add sweet potatoes, carrots, and diced tomatoes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Benachin
recipes.description: A one-pot Gambian dish made with rice, vegetables, and meat or fish.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken, cut into pieces (or fish or beef)
instructions: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add onions, garlic, and bell pepper and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add chicken (or fish or beef) and brown on all sides.
Add tomato paste, chicken broth, paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper and stir well.
Add rice, sweet potato, carrots, and green beans.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Khachapuri
recipes.description: A traditional Georgian bread filled with cheese and egg.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a bowl, mix feta cheese, mozzarella cheese, one beaten egg, and salt to taste.
Divide the bread dough into 4 pieces and roll each piece into a circle.
Add 1/4 of the cheese mixture to the center of each circle.
Fold the edges of the dough up and over the cheese mixture to form a boat shape, leaving a hole in the center.
Crack an egg into the hole of each khachapuri.
Brush melted butter over the edges of the dough.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the edges of the dough are golden brown and the eggs are cooked.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Mtsvadi
recipes.description: A popular Georgian grilled meat dish marinated in vinegar and spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs pork (or beef), cut into cubes
instructions: Soak wooden skewers in water for at least 30 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix onion, red wine vinegar, olive oil, oregano, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Add pork (or beef) cubes and stir to coat evenly.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Thread the marinated meat onto the skewers.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot with grilled vegetables and/or flatbread.

recipes.name: Schnitzel
recipes.description: A classic German dish of breaded and fried meat, typically served with potatoes and vegetables.
instructions: Pound the meat to an even thickness.
Season the meat with salt and black pepper.
Set up three bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs mixed with paprika.
Dredge each piece of meat in flour, shaking off excess, then dip in egg, and finally coat in breadcrumbs, pressing the breadcrumbs onto the meat to ensure they adhere.
Heat the oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the breaded meat and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and your choice of sides.

recipes.name: Spätzle
recipes.description: A type of German egg noodle often served as a side dish.
instructions: Mix the flour, salt, and nutmeg in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and milk together.
Add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and stir until a smooth batter forms.
Bring the salted water to a boil in a large pot.
Press the batter through a colander or spaetzle maker into the boiling water.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, until the spaetzle rise to the surface of the water.
Remove the spaetzle with a slotted spoon and transfer to a colander to drain.
Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the spaetzle and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until lightly browned and heated through.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: A popular West African dish made with rice, tomato, onion, and spices.
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, bell peppers, and tomatoes and sauté until vegetables are soft.
Add tomato paste, ginger, nutmeg, coriander, paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper, and stir to combine.
Add rice and stir to coat the grains with the spice mixture.
Add water and scotch bonnet pepper and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and let simmer for 20-25 minutes or until rice is tender and water is absorbed.
Fluff rice with a fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: Kelewele
recipes.description: A popular street food made with fried plantains and spices.
ingredients: 2 large ripe plantains, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together cayenne pepper, ginger, nutmeg, and salt.
Add plantain chunks to the spice mixture and toss to coat evenly.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Add plantain chunks to the pan and fry until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Remove from the pan and drain on a paper towel.
Serve hot as a snack or side dish.

recipes.name: Moussaka
recipes.description: A traditional Greek dish made with layers of eggplant, ground meat, and béchamel sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
In a large skillet, heat 2 tbsp of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in diced tomatoes, oregano, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper. Cook until the liquid has evaporated.
In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour and stir constantly until golden brown. Gradually whisk in milk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Cook until the mixture has thickened.
In a large baking dish, layer half of the eggplant slices on the bottom. Top with the meat mixture, then another layer of eggplant slices. Pour the béchamel sauce over the top.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top, then brush with beaten egg.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, until the top is golden brown and bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Greek Salad
recipes.description: A refreshing salad made with tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, feta cheese, and olives, dressed with olive oil and lemon juice.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Top with crumbled feta cheese and serve.

recipes.name: Oil Down
recipes.description: A traditional one-pot dish made with breadfruit, coconut milk, and salted meat.
ingredients: 1 breadfruit, peeled and cut into chunks
1 lb salted meat (pork, beef, or fish), cut into small pieces
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add salted meat, onion, garlic, thyme, and hot pepper, and sauté until meat is browned.
Add breadfruit, coconut milk, water, and salt to taste.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 45 minutes to 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until breadfruit is tender and most of the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot as a main dish.

recipes.name: Callaloo Soup
recipes.description: A soup made with callaloo leaves (similar to spinach), okra, and coconut milk.
ingredients: 1 lb callaloo leaves (or spinach), washed and chopped
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and hot pepper, and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add callaloo leaves and okra, and sauté for a few minutes.
Add coconut milk, water, and salt to taste.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes, until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot as a soup or over rice.

recipes.name: Pepián
recipes.description: A traditional Guatemalan stew made with meat, vegetables, and a thick, spicy sauce made with toasted seeds and spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken or beef, cut into pieces
1/2 cup corn masa or tortilla dough
instructions: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat and add the vegetable oil.
Add the meat and brown on all sides, then remove and set aside.
Add the onion, garlic, bell pepper, and tomato to the pot and sauté until the vegetables are soft.
In a dry pan, toast the sesame seeds, pumpkin seeds, peanuts, and almonds until lightly browned and fragrant.
In the same pan, toast the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black peppercorns, anise seeds, guajillo chilies, pasilla chilies, cinnamon stick, and cloves until fragrant.
Grind the toasted seeds and spices in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle until fine.
Add the ground spice mixture to the pot with the vegetables and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Add the broth and the browned meat to the pot and bring to a simmer.
In a small bowl, mix the corn masa or tortilla dough with enough water to form a smooth paste.
Stir the corn masa paste into the pot and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened and the meat is tender.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice or tortillas.

recipes.name: Poulet Yassa
recipes.description: A popular chicken dish marinated in a tangy mixture of lemon, onions, and spices.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the chopped onions, lemon juice, minced garlic, chopped chili pepper, vegetable oil, salt, black pepper, and Dijon mustard to make the marinade.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and stir to coat the chicken with the mixture. Cover the bowl and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken pieces from the marinade and discard the excess marinade.
Place the chicken pieces in the skillet and cook for about 10-12 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through and browned on the outside.
Serve the chicken with rice or couscous and a side of vegetables.

recipes.name: Fou Fou
recipes.description: A starchy staple food made from cassava or yam, often served as an accompaniment to stews and sauces.
instructions: Peel the cassava or yam and cut it into small pieces.
Add the cassava or yam to a large pot of boiling water, along with the salt.
Cook for about 20-30 minutes, or until the cassava or yam is tender and can be easily mashed with a fork.
Drain the water from the pot and mash the cassava or yam with a fork or a pestle until it is smooth and creamy.
Serve the fou fou hot with stews, sauces, or other dishes.

recipes.name: Jollof rice
recipes.description: A flavorful one-pot rice dish cooked in a tomato-based sauce and served with chicken or fish.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
2 lbs chicken or fish, cut into pieces (optional)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and translucent.
Add the bell peppers and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the rice, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and spices. Stir to combine.
Pour in the stock and stir to combine.
If using chicken or fish, add the pieces to the pot and stir to coat in the sauce.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover the pot.
Cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Caldo de cachupa
recipes.description: A hearty stew made with beans, corn, and vegetables, often served with bread.
ingredients: 1 cup dried beans, soaked overnight and drained
1 cup dried corn, soaked overnight and drained
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and translucent.
Add the bell pepper, sweet potato, yucca, and plantain, and sauté for another 5-7 minutes.
Add the soaked beans and corn, cilantro, paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
Pour in the water and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beans and corn are tender.
Serve hot with bread.

recipes.name: Pepperpot
recipes.description: A traditional Amerindian meat stew made with cassareep, a sauce made from the cassava root, and flavored with cinnamon, cloves, and hot peppers.
ingredients: 3 lbs beef (or pork), cut into cubes
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add meat and brown on all sides.
Add onion, garlic, scallions, thyme, cinnamon stick, cloves, and hot peppers. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add cassareep and water, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 3-4 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add salt to taste.
Serve hot with bread or rice.

recipes.name: Cook-up Rice
recipes.description: A one-pot dish made with rice, beans, coconut milk, and meat, often served with fried plantains.
ingredients: 1 lb meat (chicken, beef, or pork), cut into cubes
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Add meat and brown on all sides.
Add onion, garlic, thyme, cumin, black pepper, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add rice, black-eyed peas, coconut milk, and water. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Serve hot with fried plantains.

recipes.name: Soup Joumou
recipes.description: A traditional soup served on New Year's Day in Haiti to commemorate the country's independence. Made with vegetables, beef, and pumpkin.
instructions: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat.
Add beef and brown on all sides.
Add onion, garlic, celery, and tomato paste and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add pumpkin, carrots, turnips, parsley, scallions, salt, black pepper, thyme, cloves, nutmeg, and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tassot
recipes.description: A Haitian dish made with fried, marinated goat meat, typically served with fried plantains and pikliz (spicy pickled vegetables).
instructions: In a large bowl, combine goat meat, lime juice, vinegar, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. Let marinate for 1-2 hours.
In a large pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add marinated goat meat and fry until browned and crispy, about 10-15 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer meat to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
In the same pan, sauté onion and bell peppers until softened.
Serve fried goat meat with sautéed vegetables and fried plantains.
Optional: Serve with pikliz (spicy pickled vegetables).

recipes.name: Baleadas
recipes.description: A popular Honduran dish made with a flour tortilla, refried beans, cheese, and optionally meat and avocado.
ingredients: 1/2 cup crumbled queso fresco (or shredded cheddar cheese)
instructions: Heat tortillas on a skillet or griddle until warm and lightly browned.
Spread refried beans over each tortilla, leaving some space around the edges.
Add cheese, meat, avocado, tomatoes, and onions as desired.
Fold tortilla in half and serve hot.

recipes.name: Sopa de Caracol
recipes.description: A savory soup made with conch, vegetables, and coconut milk.
ingredients: 1 lb conch meat, cleaned and diced
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add conch meat and cook until browned on all sides.
Add cumin, coriander, paprika, allspice, thyme, oregano, salt, and black pepper, and stir well.
Add coconut milk and water, and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30-45 minutes, until conch is tender.
Serve hot with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Goulash
recipes.description: A hearty stew made with beef, vegetables, and paprika, often served with bread or pasta.
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into cubes
3 potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onions and bell peppers and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add garlic, paprika, caraway seeds, marjoram, salt, and black pepper and stir for 1-2 minutes.
Add beef and brown on all sides.
Add beef broth and diced tomatoes and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add potatoes and carrot and cook for another 30-45 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with bread or pasta.

recipes.name: Icelandic Fish Stew
recipes.description: A hearty and warming fish soup, made with a variety of fish and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 lbs mixed fish (such as cod, haddock, and salmon), cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add flour and stir for 1-2 minutes to make a roux.
Gradually whisk in the broth, stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Add potatoes, carrots, turnip, bay leaf, thyme, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Add fish and continue to simmer for another 10-15 minutes, until fish is cooked through.
Stir in heavy cream and parsley.
Remove bay leaf and serve hot.

recipes.name: Skyr Cake
recipes.description: A delicious and creamy cake made with Iceland's signature dairy product, skyr.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a mixing bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter.
Press mixture firmly into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake crust for 10-12 minutes, then remove from oven and let cool.
In a large mixing bowl, beat skyr, heavy cream, and sugar until smooth.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in vanilla extract.
In a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water until smooth.
Gradually add cornstarch mixture to skyr mixture, stirring constantly.
Pour filling over the crust and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until center is set.
Allow the cake to cool to room temperature before serving.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken
recipes.description: A creamy tomato-based curry with marinated chicken, traditionally cooked in a clay oven or tandoor.
ingredients: 1 lb boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
Cooked rice or naan bread, for serving
instructions: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, garam masala, turmeric, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt. Add chicken and marinate for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Place marinated chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add tomato puree and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add cooked chicken and heavy cream to the skillet and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
recipes.description: A spicy vegetarian dish made with chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, and a blend of Indian spices.
ingredients: 2 cans (14 oz each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté until onion is translucent.
Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add diced tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add chickpeas and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in chopped cilantro and serve hot with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Nasi Goreng
recipes.description: A popular Indonesian fried rice dish made with leftover rice, vegetables, meat, and spices.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, green beans, etc.)
instructions: Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add onion, garlic, and chili, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the shrimp paste, ground coriander, ground cumin, and turmeric, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Add the cooked rice, sweet soy sauce, fish sauce, sugar, and salt, and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes or until the rice is heated through and slightly crispy.
Make a well in the center of the rice and pour in the beaten eggs. Stir-fry until the eggs are cooked.
Add green onions and cilantro, and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Gheymeh
recipes.description: Gheymeh is a popular Persian stew made with split peas, beef, and tomatoes, and is usually served with steamed basmati rice.
ingredients: 1 lb stew beef, cut into small pieces
1 large potato, peeled and cut into small cubes
instructions: Heat some oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and onions and sauté until browned.
Add the split peas, water, tomatoes, tomato paste, turmeric, lime powder, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
Cover the pot and simmer for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, fry the potatoes until crispy and set aside.
In a small pan, sauté the cinnamon for a few seconds and add it to the pot, along with the sugar and lemon juice. Stir to combine.
Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the stew has thickened and the split peas are soft.
Serve the gheymeh hot, garnished with the fried potatoes, dried mint, and chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Tashreeb
recipes.description: Tashreeb is a traditional Iraqi dish made with bread, meat, vegetables, and broth. It is usually served during Ramadan, but is also enjoyed year-round.
ingredients: 1 lb. lamb, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté the lamb until browned. Remove from pot and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onions and garlic until softened.
Add the lamb back into the pot with the onions and garlic.
Add the spices and stir to combine.
Pour in the chicken broth and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and let simmer for about 30 minutes.
Tear the bread into small pieces and add to the pot. Stir gently to combine.
Cover the pot and let cook for another 15-20 minutes, or until the bread is soft and has absorbed most of the liquid.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Masgouf
recipes.description: Masgouf is a popular Iraqi grilled fish dish that is typically made with carp or shanbalileh fish. It is traditionally cooked over an open flame and served with lemon and onion.
ingredients: 2 lbs. carp or shanbalileh fish, cleaned and scaled
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, cumin, paprika, black pepper, coriander, and cinnamon.
Rub the fish with the spice mixture, making sure to coat it evenly.
Place the fish on the grill and cook for about 10-15 minutes on each side, or until the skin is crispy and the fish is cooked through.
While the fish is cooking, sauté the sliced onions in a small pan until they are soft and caramelized.
Serve the fish with the sautéed onions, lemon wedges, and a side of rice.

recipes.name: Irish Stew
recipes.description: Irish stew is a traditional Irish dish made from lamb, potatoes, onions, and herbs. It is a hearty and comforting meal that is perfect for cold winter days.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds lamb shoulder, cut into 1 1/2 inch pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C).
Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the lamb and brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the lamb from the pot and set aside.
Add the onions to the pot and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
Add the broth, potatoes, carrots, celery, bay leaf, thyme, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
Return the lamb to the pot and bring to a boil.
Cover the pot with a lid and place it in the oven. Cook for 2-2 1/2 hours, or until the lamb is tender.
Remove the bay leaf before serving.

recipes.name: Irish Soda Bread
recipes.description: Irish soda bread is a quick bread that is made with baking soda instead of yeast. It is a staple of Irish cuisine and is often served with butter and jam.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and baking soda.
Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the buttermilk.
Using a wooden spoon or your hands, mix the ingredients together until a shaggy dough forms.
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead lightly until it comes together into a round loaf.
Transfer the dough to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cut a deep cross in the top of the loaf with a sharp knife.
Bake for 35-45 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
Transfer the bread to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Shakshuka
recipes.description: A flavorful and healthy Middle Eastern breakfast dish featuring eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce.
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced onions and sauté until they become soft and translucent.
Add minced garlic and diced bell peppers to the skillet and cook for a few more minutes.
Pour the can of diced tomatoes into the skillet and add the paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. Stir well and let the mixture simmer for 5-10 minutes, until the sauce thickens.

Use a spoon to make small wells in the sauce, and crack an egg into each well. Cover the skillet and let the eggs poach in the sauce for 5-7 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese and chopped parsley over the top of the shakshuka.
Serve hot with crusty bread or pita.

recipes.name: Hummus
recipes.description: A classic and delicious dip made from chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Pulse until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
With the food processor running, slowly drizzle in olive oil until the hummus is the desired consistency.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Serve cold or at room temperature with pita chips, vegetables, or crackers.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A classic pasta dish from Rome made with spaghetti, eggs, guanciale or pancetta, pecorino cheese, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
Meanwhile, cook guanciale or pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy and golden brown.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, pecorino cheese, and black pepper until well combined.
When spaghetti is done, reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the guanciale or pancetta. Toss to combine.
Remove the skillet from heat and let it cool for a minute or two, then add the egg mixture and stir well until the spaghetti is coated in the sauce.
If the sauce is too thick, add reserved pasta cooking water 1 tablespoon at a time until desired consistency is reached.
Serve hot with additional grated pecorino cheese and black pepper, if desired.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
recipes.description: A simple pizza topped with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese, and basil leaves. Named after Queen Margherita of Savoy, this pizza represents the colors of the Italian flag: red, white, and green.
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to a 12-inch circle.
Place the pizza dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread the tomato sauce over the pizza dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Arrange the sliced mozzarella cheese on top of the tomato sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a minute or two, then top with fresh basil leaves.
Slice and serve hot.

recipes.name: Jamaican Jerk Chicken
recipes.description: This classic Jamaican dish features chicken marinated in a spicy blend of herbs and spices, then grilled or roasted to perfection.
ingredients: 4 chicken legs, split into thighs and drumsticks
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, vinegar, oil, brown sugar, thyme, allspice, cinnamon, ginger, black pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic, and onion.
Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove the chicken from the marinade and arrange it in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the skin is crispy.
Serve with rice and beans, or your favorite Jamaican side dishes.

recipes.name: Sushi Rolls
recipes.description: Sushi rolls are a classic Japanese dish that have become popular all over the world. This recipe shows you how to make your own sushi rolls at home!
ingredients: Assorted sushi fillings (such as cucumber, avocado, crab meat, and salmon)
instructions: Rinse the sushi rice in a fine mesh strainer until the water runs clear.
In a medium saucepan, combine the rice and water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove the rice from the heat and let it sit for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a large bowl.
In a small saucepan, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Heat over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar and salt dissolve.
Pour the vinegar mixture over the rice and use a wooden spoon to gently stir and fold the rice until it is evenly coated.
Place a sheet of nori on a sushi mat or piece of plastic wrap. Spread a layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top edge.
Arrange the sushi fillings on top of the rice.
Roll up the sushi tightly, using the mat or plastic wrap to help you. Use a sharp knife to cut the sushi into slices.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

recipes.name: Tempura
recipes.description: Tempura is a classic Japanese dish of battered and deep-fried seafood and vegetables. This recipe shows you how to make crispy, delicious tempura at home!
ingredients: 1/2 pound assorted vegetables (such as sweet potato, onion, and broccoli)
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, ice-cold water, and egg yolk until smooth.
In a heavy-bottomed pot or deep fryer, heat the vegetable oil to 375 degrees F.
Dip the shrimp and vegetables in the batter and let any excess batter drip off.
Fry the shrimp and vegetables in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per batch.
Drain the tempura on a wire rack or paper towels.
Serve with tempura dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Mansaf
recipes.description: A traditional Jordanian dish made of lamb cooked in a sauce of fermented dried yogurt and served with rice and topped with almonds and parsley.
ingredients: 2 lbs bone-in lamb shoulder, cut into large pieces
instructions: Soak the rice in cold water for 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the lamb and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Add the cumin, coriander, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add enough water to the pot to cover the lamb by 1 inch. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, until the lamb is tender.
In a separate pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Drain the rice and add it to the boiling water. Cook for 10 minutes, or until the rice is tender.
In a bowl, mix together the yogurt and fermented dried yogurt until well combined.
To serve, spread the cooked rice on a large platter. Place the cooked lamb on top of the rice and spoon the yogurt sauce over the lamb. Garnish with slivered almonds and chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Falafel
recipes.description: A popular Middle Eastern food made of ground chickpeas, herbs, and spices formed into balls or patties and fried until crispy.
instructions: Soak the chickpeas in water for 24 hours.
Drain the chickpeas and rinse them thoroughly.

In a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, flour, cumin, coriander, baking soda, salt, and pepper. Pulse until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat the oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 375°F.
Fry the falafel in the hot oil for 3-4 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot with tahini sauce and pita bread.

recipes.name: Beshbarmak
recipes.description: Beshbarmak is the national dish of Kazakhstan, consisting of boiled meat (usually beef or mutton) served over sheets of homemade pasta.
instructions: In a large pot, boil the meat until tender.
Remove the meat from the pot and set aside. Keep the broth for later use.
In a separate pot, boil the chopped potatoes and carrots until tender.
To make the pasta, mix together the flour, egg, and water until a dough forms.
Knead the dough for several minutes, then roll it out on a floured surface until it's about 1/4 inch thick.
Cut the dough into squares or diamond shapes.
Boil the pasta in the meat broth until cooked through.
To serve, place the pasta on a platter and top with the boiled meat, potatoes, and carrots. Pour the meat broth over everything and season with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Kazy
recipes.description: Kazy is a traditional Kazakh sausage made from horse meat. It is usually served cold and sliced thinly.
instructions: Grind the horse meat using a meat grinder or food processor.
Mix the ground meat with the salt, black pepper, cumin, and coriander.
Stuff the meat mixture into sausage casings.
Hang the sausages in a cool, dry place to dry for 2-3 days.
Boil the sausages in water for 30 minutes.
Remove the sausages from the water and let them cool.
Slice the sausages thinly and serve cold.

recipes.name: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
recipes.description: Ugali is a staple food in Kenya made from maize flour, and is usually eaten with a side dish. Sukuma wiki, which translates to 'stretch the week', is a common vegetable dish that is easy to prepare and affordable.
ingredients: 1 bunch of kale or collard greens, chopped
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the maize flour to the pot and stir continuously until it thickens and forms a dense dough.
Cover the pot and let the ugali cook on low heat for about 15 minutes.
In another pan, heat the vegetable oil and fry the onions until they are soft and translucent.
Add the tomatoes and stir-fry for a few minutes.
Add the chopped kale or collard greens and stir-fry until they are wilted and cooked through.
Add salt to taste and serve the sukuma wiki alongside the ugali.

recipes.name: Nyama Choma
recipes.description: Nyama choma is a popular Kenyan dish consisting of grilled meat, usually goat or beef. It is often served with kachumbari, a fresh tomato and onion salad.
ingredients: 2 lbs goat or beef, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the meat, onion, garlic, vegetable oil, paprika, cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper. Mix well to coat the meat evenly.
Let the meat marinate in the fridge for at least an hour, or overnight for best results.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Thread the meat onto skewers and grill for 10-15 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Serve the nyama choma hot, with lemon wedges and kachumbari on the side.

recipes.name: Kakabai
recipes.description: Kakabai is a traditional dish in Kiribati, made with salted fish and coconut cream. It is usually served with breadfruit or rice.
instructions: Soak the salted fish in water for a few hours to remove excess salt.
Drain the fish and cut into small pieces.
In a pan, heat the cooking oil and fry the onions, garlic, and chilies until fragrant.
Add the tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add the fish and salt, and cook for about 5 minutes.
Add the coconut cream and cook for another 5 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot with breadfruit or rice.

recipes.name: Kakamora
recipes.description: Kakamora is a traditional dessert in Kiribati made with coconut, bananas, and sugar.
instructions: Peel and slice the bananas.
In a saucepan, combine the grated coconut, sugar, salt, and water.
Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add the sliced bananas and cook for about 5 minutes, until the bananas are soft and the sauce thickens.
Serve hot or cold.

recipes.name: Machboos
recipes.description: Machboos is a traditional Kuwaiti rice dish with chicken, onion, and spices.
instructions: Wash and clean the chicken, then cut it into pieces. Cut the onions into thin slices.
Heat the oil in a large pot, then add the onions and cook until they are golden brown.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook for 10 minutes until the chicken is browned.

Add the tomato paste, bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, black pepper, salt, cardamom pods, garlic, and green chillies to the pot. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add 6 cups of water to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer for 30-35 minutes until the chicken is cooked and tender.
Remove the chicken pieces from the pot and set aside. Strain the chicken broth through a sieve and reserve it.
Wash the rice and soak it in cold water for 10 minutes. Drain the rice and set aside.
Heat 1/4 cup of oil in a large pot, then add the rice and cook for 2-3 minutes until the rice is slightly browned.
Add 7 cups of the reserved chicken broth to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes until the rice is cooked.
Serve the Machboos hot with the chicken pieces on top.

recipes.name: Beshbarmak
recipes.description: Beshbarmak is a traditional Kyrgyz dish made with boiled meat (usually lamb or beef) and pasta sheets, served with a flavorful onion sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb lamb or beef, cut into chunks
instructions: In a large pot, bring salted water to a boil. Add the meat and simmer for 30 minutes or until cooked.
Remove the meat from the pot and set aside. Reserve the broth.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, warm water, and vegetable oil. Knead the dough until smooth.
Roll out the dough into thin sheets and cut into small pieces.
Add the pasta to the meat broth and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
In a large skillet, sauté the onions until caramelized. Add the cooked meat, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
To serve, place the pasta on a platter, top with the meat and onion mixture, and drizzle with some of the broth.

recipes.name: Laghman
recipes.description: Laghman is a popular Kyrgyz noodle dish made with hand-pulled noodles, meat, and vegetables in a flavorful sauce.
instructions: In a large pot, brown the meat over medium heat. Remove from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, carrot, bell pepper, and garlic until soft.
Add the tomato paste and stir to combine.
Return the meat to the pot and add the beef broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, warm water, and vegetable oil. Knead the dough until smooth.
Roll out the dough into thin sheets and cut into thin noodles.
Add the noodles to the pot and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
To serve, ladle the noodles and meat into bowls and spoon some of the sauce over the top.

recipes.name: Laab (Larb)
recipes.description: Laab is a spicy and sour salad made with ground meat, typically pork or beef, and seasoned with lime juice, chili peppers, fish sauce, and fresh herbs. It is a staple dish in Lao cuisine and is often served as an appetizer or main course.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the ground meat with the lime juice and fish sauce.
Add the ground roasted rice, green onions, cilantro, mint leaves, dill, and shallots to the bowl and mix well.
Add the sliced chili peppers to the bowl and mix again.
Serve the laab salad at room temperature with lettuce leaves for wrapping.

recipes.name: Khao Piak Sen (Lao Noodle Soup)
recipes.description: Khao Piak Sen is a hearty and comforting noodle soup made with homemade rice noodles and chicken broth. It is typically served with sliced chicken or pork, bean sprouts, cilantro, and lime wedges.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the chicken thighs, fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and black pepper to a boil over high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the chicken for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the pot and let it cool slightly before shredding it with a fork.
In another pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil over high heat.
Add the fresh rice noodles to the pot and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until tender.
Divide the noodles among 4-6 serving bowls and top with the shredded chicken, bean sprouts, cilantro, and chili peppers.
Ladle the hot chicken broth over the noodles and serve with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Grey Peas and Bacon
recipes.description: A traditional Latvian dish made with grey peas and bacon.
instructions: Soak the peas in water overnight.
Drain the peas and add them to a large pot with 8 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender, about 1 hour.
In a separate pan, fry the bacon until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the chopped onion to the bacon grease and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the cooked bacon and onion mixture to the pot with the peas. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Simmer for another 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve hot, topped with a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.name: Piragi
recipes.description: A Latvian version of the popular Eastern European stuffed bread.
instructions: Combine the milk, water, melted butter, sugar, and yeast in a large mixing bowl.
Add the flour and salt and mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes, until it is smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1 hour.
In a large skillet, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the chopped onions to the bacon grease and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the cooked bacon, black pepper, and nutmeg and stir to combine.
Preheat the oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness.
Use a biscuit cutter or drinking glass to cut out circles of dough.
Place a spoonful of the bacon and onion mixture in the center of each circle.
Fold the edges of the circle up and over the filling, pinching the edges together to seal.
Place the piragi on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with beaten egg.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Tabbouleh
recipes.description: Tabbouleh is a classic Lebanese salad that is made with parsley, tomatoes, onions, and bulgur wheat. It is seasoned with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt, and is usually served as a side dish or a mezze.
instructions: Soak the bulgur wheat in cold water for 30 minutes.
Drain the bulgur wheat and squeeze out any excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the bulgur wheat, parsley, mint, green onions, and tomatoes.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and salt.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Chill the salad in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Kibbeh Nayeh
recipes.description: Kibbeh Nayeh is a popular Lebanese dish made with raw ground beef or lamb and bulgur wheat. It is usually served as an appetizer or a mezze, and is seasoned with spices and olive oil.
ingredients: 1 lb. raw ground beef or lamb
instructions: Soak the bulgur wheat in cold water for 30 minutes.
Drain the bulgur wheat and squeeze out any excess water.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef or lamb, soaked bulgur wheat, onion, salt, black pepper, cumin, and cinnamon.
Knead the mixture together until it is well combined.
Spread the mixture out on a platter, and use a spoon or your hands to make a well in the center.
Pour the olive oil into the well.
Garnish the top of the kibbeh with the chopped mint, parsley, cilantro, and green onions.
Serve the kibbeh with pita bread or crackers.

recipes.name: Papa
recipes.description: Papa is a staple food in Lesotho, made from maize meal and water. It is similar to porridge or grits, and is usually served with vegetables and meat.
instructions: Bring the water to a boil in a large pot.
Slowly add the maize meal, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Reduce the heat to low, and continue stirring for 20-30 minutes until the mixture thickens and becomes smooth.
Add salt to taste, and serve hot with vegetables and meat.

recipes.name: Sechu
recipes.description: Sechu is a traditional Lesotho dish made with dried corn leaves and beans. It is typically served as a side dish or a snack.
instructions: Soak the dried corn leaves in water for several hours until they are soft.
In a large pot, boil the beans until they are tender.
Drain the beans, and add the corn leaves to the pot.
Saute the onion and garlic in vegetable oil until they are soft and fragrant.
Add the tomatoes to the pot, and continue cooking until they are tender.
Add the onion mixture to the pot, and stir well to combine.
Add salt to taste, and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the mixture is heated through.
Serve hot as a side dish or a snack.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: Jollof Rice is a popular Liberian dish made with rice, tomatoes, onions, and spices. It is often served with fried plantains or grilled meat.
instructions: Wash the rice and drain.
In a pot, add the rice, water, onion, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, salt, paprika, black pepper, and oil.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid.
Cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.

recipes.name: Cassava Leaf Soup
recipes.description: Cassava Leaf Soup is a traditional Liberian dish made with cassava leaves, palm oil, onions, and meat. It is often served with rice or fufu.
ingredients: 2 lbs. meat (chicken, beef, or goat), cubed
instructions: In a large pot, add the cassava leaves, meat, onion, palm oil, and water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until the meat is tender and the cassava leaves are soft.
Add the peanut butter, salt, black pepper, and hot pepper (if using), and stir until well combined.
Continue to simmer for an additional 30-45 minutes, or until the soup has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
Serve hot with rice or fufu.

recipes.name: Bazin
recipes.description: Bazin is a traditional Libyan dish that is made from a type of flour called barley flour. It is often eaten with a sauce made from meat, vegetables, and spices.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the barley flour and water until a dough forms.
Knead the dough for several minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Form the dough into small balls and flatten them into discs.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the discs of dough to the pot and boil for 10-15 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Remove the discs of dough from the water and serve with a sauce made from meat, vegetables, and spices.

recipes.name: Shakshouka
recipes.description: Shakshouka is a popular Libyan dish made from eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce. It is often served for breakfast or brunch, and is usually eaten with bread for dipping in the sauce.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the onion and red bell pepper and cook until they are soft and translucent.
Add the garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne pepper, and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the crushed tomatoes and salt to the skillet, and stir to combine.
Simmer the sauce for 10-15 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
Use a spoon to make 4-6 indentations in the sauce.
Crack an egg into each indentation.
Cover the skillet and let the eggs cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are set to your liking.
Sprinkle the chopped parsley over the top of the shakshouka.
Serve the shakshouka hot, with bread for dipping in the sauce.

recipes.name: Käsknöpfle
recipes.description: Käsknöpfle is a traditional dish from Liechtenstein, similar to Austrian Spätzle or Swiss Chäschüechli. It consists of soft egg noodles topped with melted cheese and fried onions.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, eggs, milk, salt, nutmeg, and black pepper to make a smooth batter.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.

Using a spaetzle maker or a colander with large holes, press the batter through into the boiling water. Cook until the spaetzle float to the surface, then remove them with a slotted spoon and place them in a large bowl.
In a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until soft and golden brown, stirring frequently.

Pour the melted butter and onions over the spaetzle in the bowl, then add the grated Gruyere and Parmesan cheese. Toss everything together until the cheese is melted and the spaetzle are coated in the sauce.
Serve the Käsknöpfle hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired.

recipes.name: Ribel
recipes.description: Ribel is a traditional polenta-like dish from Liechtenstein, made with cornmeal and milk. It is usually served as a side dish with sausages or other meat dishes.
instructions: In a large saucepan, bring the milk to a boil.
Gradually whisk in the cornmeal, salt, black pepper, and nutmeg, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the ribel for 20-30 minutes, stirring frequently, until it is thick and creamy.
Stir in the butter until it is melted and well combined.
Serve the ribel hot, as a side dish with sausages or other meat dishes.

recipes.name: Cepelinai
recipes.description: Cepelinai is a traditional Lithuanian dish made with grated potatoes and stuffed with meat. It is usually served with sour cream and bacon.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the grated potatoes, flour, salt, and pepper.
Knead the mixture until it forms a dough.
In a separate bowl, combine the ground pork, onion, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Form the potato dough into small balls, and flatten them into circles.
Place a spoonful of the meat mixture in the center of each circle.
Pinch the edges of the dough together to seal the filling inside.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the cepelinai to the boiling water, and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Serve the cepelinai hot, topped with sour cream and crumbled bacon.

recipes.name: Kugelis
recipes.description: Kugelis is a Lithuanian potato pudding that is usually served as a main dish. It is made with grated potatoes, bacon, onions, and eggs, and is usually served with sour cream.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine the grated potatoes, chopped onion, crumbled bacon, beaten eggs, milk, flour, salt, and pepper.
Stir the mixture until it is well combined.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish.
Bake the kugelis for 1 hour, or until it is golden brown and cooked through.
Serve the kugelis hot, topped with sour cream.

recipes.name: Judd mat Gaardebounen
recipes.description: Judd mat Gaardebounen is the national dish of Luxembourg, and is made with smoked pork collar and broad beans. It is usually served with boiled potatoes and a side of applesauce.
instructions: Soak the broad beans in water overnight.
In a large pot, combine the pork collar, soaked beans, onion, garlic, carrots, celery, bay leaf, thyme, salt, and pepper. Add enough water to cover the ingredients by 2 inches.
Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 2 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Remove the meat from the pot and set aside. Discard the bay leaf and thyme sprig.
In a separate pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and whisk together to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in the chicken broth until the mixture is smooth.
Add the vegetables and broth from the pork collar pot to the roux pot. Bring the mixture to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
Slice the pork collar and serve with the broad beans and sauce, along with boiled potatoes and applesauce.

recipes.name: Gromperekichelcher
recipes.description: Gromperekichelcher is a traditional Luxembourgish potato pancake that is often served as a snack or appetizer. It is made with grated potatoes, flour, onions, and seasonings, and is usually fried until crispy.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the grated potatoes, onion, egg, flour, salt, and pepper.
Heat about 1/4 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Using a spoon, drop the potato mixture into the hot oil and flatten with the back of the spoon to form a pancake.
Fry the pancake for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the pancake from the skillet and place on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
Repeat the process with the remaining potato mixture, adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
Serve the gromperekichelcher hot, with applesauce or sour cream as a dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Nsima
recipes.description: Nsima is a staple food in Malawi and is made from ground maize flour. It is usually served with stews or sauces, and is similar to other African dishes such as ugali and fufu.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add a pinch of salt.
Slowly add the maize flour to the pot, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon.
Reduce the heat to low and continue stirring until the mixture thickens and forms a stiff dough.
Cover the pot and let the nsima cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent it from sticking to the pot.
Remove the pot from the heat and let the nsima cool for a few minutes.
Divide the nsima into portions and shape it into balls or patties with wet hands.
Serve the nsima with stews or sauces.

recipes.name: Chambo
recipes.description: Chambo is a popular fish in Malawi and is often served grilled or fried. It is usually marinated with a mixture of spices and herbs before cooking, and is often served with nsima and vegetables.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together the paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Rub the spice mixture all over the chambo fish, inside and out.
Let the fish marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat a grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Brush the grill with vegetable oil to prevent sticking.
Grill the chambo fish for 8-10 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and golden brown.
Serve the chambo with lemon wedges, nsima, and vegetables.

recipes.name: Nasi Lemak
recipes.description: Nasi Lemak is a popular dish in Malaysia that is typically eaten for breakfast. It consists of coconut rice, sambal, fried anchovies, roasted peanuts, cucumber, and a boiled egg. It is usually served with fried chicken or beef rendang.
ingredients: 1 pandan leaf, tied in a knot
instructions: Rinse the rice and drain well.
In a medium-sized pot, combine the rice, coconut milk, pandan leaf, and salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer the rice for 20 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through.
Remove the pandan leaf and fluff the rice with a fork.
Serve the rice with the fried anchovies, roasted peanuts, sliced cucumber, boiled eggs, and sambal.

recipes.name: Satay
recipes.description: Satay is a popular street food in Malaysia that consists of marinated meat skewered and grilled over charcoal. It is typically served with peanut sauce, cucumbers, and onions.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken or beef, cut into thin strips
Bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chicken or beef strips, coconut milk, soy sauce, brown sugar, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and cloves.
Stir to coat the meat well, then cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Thread the marinated meat onto the soaked bamboo skewers.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Grill the skewers for 8-10 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve the satay with the peanut sauce, sliced cucumber, and onion.

recipes.name: Garudhiya
recipes.description: Garudhiya is a traditional Maldivian fish soup that is simple to prepare and bursting with flavor. It is typically made with tuna, but you can also use other fish like mahi-mahi or snapper. The soup is seasoned with Maldivian curry powder and served with steamed rice and lime wedges.
instructions: In a large pot, combine the tuna, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, and water.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the broth is flavorful.
Season the soup with salt, to taste.
Serve the garudhiya hot with steamed rice and lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Bis Keemiya
recipes.description: Bis Keemiya is a popular snack in the Maldives that is similar to samosas. It is a pastry filled with spiced tuna or chicken and vegetables, then fried until crispy. These tasty treats are perfect for a quick bite on the go or as an appetizer.
ingredients: 1/2 lb. tuna or chicken, cooked and shredded
10-12 sheets of spring roll wrappers or pastry sheets
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, onion, green chili pepper, shredded tuna or chicken, curry powder, cumin, turmeric, salt, pepper, and cilantro.
Mix everything together until well combined.
Lay out the spring roll wrappers or pastry sheets on a clean surface.
Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each wrapper, then fold the sides over and roll the wrapper up tightly, like a burrito.
Seal the edges with a bit of water.
Heat the oil in a deep fryer or a heavy-bottomed pot.
When the oil is hot, add the bis keemiya and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the bis keemiya from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve the bis keemiya hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: Jollof rice is a popular dish in West Africa, including Mali. It is made with rice, tomatoes, onions, and a variety of spices. It can be served as a main dish or a side dish, and is often accompanied by chicken or other meats.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the can of tomatoes, smoked paprika, cumin, ground ginger, thyme, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the rice and water to the pot and stir well.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Cook for about 25 minutes or until the rice is tender.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: Tigadegena
recipes.description: Tigadegena is a sweet and spicy peanut butter sauce that is popular in Mali. It is often served over rice or couscous and can also be used as a dipping sauce for vegetables or bread.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the can of tomatoes, ground ginger, cayenne pepper, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the peanut butter and water to the pot and stir well.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot over rice or couscous.

recipes.name: Pastizzi
recipes.description: Pastizzi are a traditional Maltese pastry that can be filled with either ricotta cheese or mashed peas. They are typically eaten as a snack and are often served with a cold drink.
ingredients: 1/2 lb. ricotta cheese or 1/2 lb. mashed peas
