instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, water, and salt. Mix until a smooth dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes, until it is smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into 12 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball.
Flatten each ball with a rolling pin to form a thin disc.
Place a spoonful of ricotta cheese or mashed peas on one half of each disc.
Fold the other half of the disc over the filling and press the edges together to seal.
Brush each pastizz with beaten egg.
Bake the pastizzi in a preheated oven at 375°F for about 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
Serve hot or warm.

recipes.name: Fenek Moqli (Fried Rabbit)
recipes.description: Fenek Moqli is a traditional Maltese dish that consists of fried rabbit. It is typically served with potatoes and salad, and is a popular dish during the Maltese hunting season.
ingredients: 1 rabbit, cleaned and cut into pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, black pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
Dredge the rabbit pieces in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add the rabbit pieces to the pan and fry until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove the rabbit pieces from the pan and drain on paper towels.
Serve the fried rabbit with boiled potatoes and a salad.

recipes.name: Jebwod Coconut Breadfruit
recipes.description: Jebwod is a traditional Marshallese dish made with breadfruit and coconut milk. It is usually served as a main course and can be accompanied by fish or chicken.
instructions: Peel the breadfruit and cut it into small pieces.
In a large pot, bring the coconut milk to a boil.
Add the chopped onion, salt, and black pepper to the pot.
Add the breadfruit pieces to the pot and stir well.
Reduce the heat and let the breadfruit cook for 30-45 minutes, or until it is soft and tender.
Serve the jebwod hot with fish or chicken.

recipes.name: Iakwe
recipes.description: Iakwe is a traditional Marshallese dessert made with coconut, sugar, and pandanus leaves. It is usually served as a sweet treat after a meal or during special occasions.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the grated coconut, sugar, water, and vanilla extract.
Cut the pandanus leaves into strips and tie them into knots.
Add the pandanus knots to the coconut mixture and stir well.
Squeeze the pandanus knots to release their flavor and discard them.
Pour the coconut mixture into a saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, for 30-45 minutes, or until the mixture thickens and turns golden brown.
Remove the pan from the heat and let the mixture cool.
Serve the iakwe at room temperature.

recipes.name: Thieboudienne
recipes.description: Thieboudienne is a traditional dish from Mauritania that is made with fish and rice. It is usually served with vegetables and a spicy tomato-based sauce. The fish is first fried, then added to a tomato and vegetable stew, and finally served on a bed of seasoned rice.
ingredients: 2 lbs. fish (such as red snapper or grouper), cleaned and scaled
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the fish to the pot and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Remove the fish from the pot and set it aside.
Add the onions, garlic, and tomato paste to the pot and cook until the onions are translucent.
Add the carrots, tomatoes, eggplant, bell pepper, hot pepper, salt, and black pepper to the pot, and stir to combine.
Add enough water to the pot to cover the vegetables, and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
While the stew is simmering, wash the rice and add it to a separate pot with 4 cups of water.
Bring the rice to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and fluffy.
Serve the fish and stew on a bed of seasoned rice.

recipes.name: Dhal Puri
recipes.description: Dhal puri is a popular street food in Mauritius that is made with a split pea filling wrapped in a thin, flaky flatbread. It is often served with chutney and pickles.
instructions: Rinse the split peas and soak them in water for 2-3 hours.
Drain the split peas and blend them in a food processor until they form a smooth paste.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, salt, turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder.
Add the split pea paste and water to the mixing bowl and knead the dough for 10-15 minutes.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into 8-10 portions.
Roll out each portion of dough into a thin circle.
Place 2-3 tablespoons of the split pea filling in the center of the dough circle.
Fold the edges of the dough over the filling and pinch the edges together to seal the filling inside.
Roll out the filled dough into a thin circle.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add a small amount of oil.
Fry each dhal puri for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.
Serve the dhal puri with chutney and pickles.

recipes.name: Tacos al Pastor
recipes.description: Tacos al Pastor are a popular Mexican street food that are made with marinated pork that is grilled on a spit and served on a tortilla with pineapple, onion, and cilantro. The marinade is made with a blend of chili peppers, spices, and pineapple juice.
ingredients: 1 lb. pork shoulder, sliced into thin strips
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the achiote paste, white vinegar, chipotle chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, oregano, cinnamon, salt, black pepper, pineapple juice, and orange juice.
Add the sliced pork to the bowl, and toss to coat with the marinade.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to high heat.
Thread the marinated pork onto skewers, and grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
While the pork is cooking, grill the sliced onion and pineapple until they are lightly charred.
To serve, heat the tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet.
Top each tortilla with grilled pork, onion, and pineapple.
Garnish with chopped cilantro, and serve with lime wedges.

recipes.name: Guacamole
recipes.description: Guacamole is a classic Mexican dip that is made with ripe avocados, onion, tomato, and lime juice. It is seasoned with salt and sometimes chili peppers or cilantro.
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine the mashed avocados, onion, tomato, and lime juice.
Season the guacamole with salt to taste, and stir to combine.
Serve the guacamole immediately, or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Chicken Kelaguen
recipes.description: Chicken Kelaguen is a traditional Micronesian dish that is made with cooked and chopped chicken, grated coconut, and lemon juice. It is usually served as a main dish or a side dish, and is commonly eaten with rice or breadfruit.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken breast, cooked and chopped
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the cooked and chopped chicken, grated coconut, lemon juice, onion, salt, black pepper, and hot pepper.
Mix everything together until it is well combined.
Chill the chicken kelaguen in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Grilled Fish with Mango Salsa
recipes.description: Grilled Fish with Mango Salsa is a flavorful and healthy dish that is perfect for summer. It is made with grilled fish fillets and a fresh and tangy mango salsa that is made with chopped mango, red onion, jalapeno pepper, and cilantro.
ingredients: 4 fish fillets (such as mahi mahi or snapper)
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the fish fillets with olive oil and season them with salt and pepper.
Grill the fish fillets for 4-5 minutes per side, or until they are cooked through.
In a medium bowl, combine the chopped mango, red onion, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, lime juice, honey, and a pinch of salt.
Mix everything together until it is well combined.
Serve the grilled fish fillets with the mango salsa on top.

recipes.name: Mamaliga
recipes.description: Mamaliga is a traditional Moldovan dish that is similar to polenta. It is made from cornmeal, water, and salt, and is usually served as a side dish. Mamaliga is often eaten with sour cream or cheese.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water and salt to a boil.
Slowly add the cornmeal, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Reduce the heat to low and continue to stir the mixture for 15-20 minutes, until it becomes thick and pulls away from the sides of the pot.
Remove the pot from the heat and let the mamaliga cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Sarmale
recipes.description: Sarmale are stuffed cabbage rolls that are a popular dish in Moldova. They are usually filled with a mixture of rice, ground meat, and spices, and are often served with sour cream or tomato sauce.
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the head of cabbage and cook for about 5 minutes, until the outer leaves are tender.
Remove the cabbage from the water and carefully peel off the leaves. Set the leaves aside.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground pork, onion, uncooked rice, tomato paste, salt, black pepper, paprika, cumin, and cinnamon.
Take one cabbage leaf and place a spoonful of the pork mixture in the center. Roll up the cabbage leaf, tucking in the sides as you go. Repeat with the remaining cabbage leaves and pork mixture.
Arrange the cabbage rolls in a large pot. Add enough water to cover the cabbage rolls by about an inch.
Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat and let the cabbage rolls simmer for about 1 hour, until the rice is cooked and the meat is tender.
Serve the sarmale hot, garnished with sour cream.

recipes.name: Barbagiuan
recipes.description: Barbagiuan is a traditional Monegasque dish that is similar to a savory pastry or turnover. It is made with a filling of Swiss chard or spinach, ricotta cheese, onions, and Parmesan cheese, and is encased in a pastry made with flour, olive oil, and white wine.
instructions: Wash the Swiss chard or spinach and remove the stems and veins. Chop the leaves finely.
In a large bowl, combine the Swiss chard or spinach, ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, onions, garlic, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper.
Mix well to combine the ingredients.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, olive oil, and white wine.
Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic.
Roll out the dough into thin sheets.
Cut the sheets into 4-inch squares.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each square.
Fold the squares into triangles and press the edges to seal them.
Fry the barbagiuan in hot oil until they are golden brown.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Fougasse
recipes.description: Fougasse is a traditional Monegasque bread that is similar to a French baguette. It is made with flour, yeast, olive oil, and water, and is shaped into a leaf or a sheaf.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the flour, yeast, and salt.
Add the olive oil and warm water, and mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough with a towel and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Shape the dough into a leaf or a sheaf.
Place the fougasse on a baking sheet and let it rise for another 15 minutes.
Bake the fougasse for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
Serve the fougasse warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Buuz (Mongolian dumplings)
recipes.description: Buuz is a traditional Mongolian dish that consists of steamed dumplings filled with ground meat and onions. It is typically served as a main course and is a popular food during the Mongolian New Year celebration.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef or lamb, onion, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of a dumpling wrapper.
Wet the edges of the wrapper with water and fold it in half, pressing the edges together to seal the dumpling.
Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Steam the dumplings for 15-20 minutes, until cooked through.
Serve hot with soy sauce or other dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Khorkhog (Mongolian barbecue)
recipes.description: Khorkhog is a traditional Mongolian barbecue that is made by cooking meat and vegetables in a metal pot over hot stones. The dish is seasoned with salt and other spices, and is typically served with bread or rice.
ingredients: 2 lbs. lamb or beef, cut into small pieces
instructions: Place the river stones in a large metal pot and heat them over a fire for 1-2 hours, until they are hot.
In a large bowl, combine the meat, onion, salt, black pepper, cumin, and chili powder. Mix well.
Place the meat mixture in the pot with the hot stones and add enough water to cover the meat.
Cover the pot with a lid and let it cook for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the meat is cooked through.
Serve hot with bread or rice.

recipes.name: Ćevapi
recipes.description: Ćevapi is a grilled dish of minced meat shaped into sausages, and is commonly found throughout the Balkans. In Montenegro, it is typically served with lepinja bread and ajvar, a red pepper relish.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, ground lamb, sparkling water, garlic, onion, salt, black pepper, paprika, and cumin.
Knead the mixture together until it is well combined.
Shape the meat into sausage-like logs, and grill them over medium-high heat until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
Serve the Ćevapi with lepinja bread and ajvar.

recipes.name: Kacamak
recipes.description: Kacamak is a hearty cornmeal porridge that is a staple in Montenegrin cuisine. It is typically served as a side dish with meat, vegetables, or cheese.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water, milk, and salt to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, and gradually whisk in the cornmeal, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Continue cooking the porridge, stirring frequently, until it thickens and begins to pull away from the sides of the pot, about 20-30 minutes.
Stir in the butter, and serve the kacamak hot with cheese on top.

recipes.name: Tagine
recipes.description: Tagine is a classic Moroccan dish that is slow-cooked in a conical clay pot. It can be made with a variety of meats or vegetables, and is typically seasoned with a blend of spices, including cinnamon, cumin, and turmeric.
ingredients: 2 lbs. bone-in chicken or beef, cut into pieces
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a tagine or a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken or beef and brown on all sides.
Remove the meat from the pot and set aside.
Add the onion and garlic to the pot and sauté until softened.
Add the tomato paste, cumin, cinnamon, turmeric, ginger, black pepper, and salt, and stir to combine.
Add the saffron threads, chicken broth, and water, and bring the mixture to a boil.
Return the meat to the pot, along with the carrots and potatoes.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the green beans, parsley, cilantro, and mint, and continue to simmer for an additional 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the meat is cooked through.
Serve the tagine hot, with lemon wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Matapa
recipes.description: Matapa is a traditional dish from Mozambique made with cassava leaves, peanuts, coconut milk, garlic, and shrimp. It is usually served with rice and is a popular dish for special occasions.
ingredients: 2 lbs. cassava leaves, washed and finely chopped
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the garlic, onion, and tomato and sauté until the onion is soft and translucent.
Add the peanuts and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the cassava leaves and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the shrimp and cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through.
Add the coconut milk and salt to taste.
Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Mohinga
recipes.description: Mohinga is a traditional breakfast dish in Myanmar. It is a savory fish soup made with lemongrass, ginger, garlic, onions, and fish sauce, and is served over rice noodles. It is typically garnished with cilantro, hard-boiled eggs, and crispy fried fritters.
instructions: In a large pot, combine the catfish, water, lemongrass, ginger, garlic, and onions.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 30 minutes.
Remove the catfish from the pot and flake the meat into small pieces. Discard the bones and skin.
Add the fish sauce, turmeric powder, chili powder, paprika, and salt to the pot. Stir to combine.
Add the flaked catfish back to the pot and let simmer for another 10 minutes.
Cook the rice noodles according to package instructions.
To serve, divide the rice noodles among four bowls. Ladle the soup over the noodles.
Garnish each bowl with cilantro, sliced hard-boiled eggs, and crispy fried fritters.

recipes.name: Biltong
recipes.description: Biltong is a popular Namibian snack made from dried, cured meat, similar to beef jerky. It can be made from a variety of meats such as beef, game, or ostrich, and is often seasoned with vinegar, salt, coriander, and other spices.
ingredients: 2 lbs. beef, game, or ostrich meat
instructions: Slice the meat into thin strips, about 1/4 inch thick.
In a large bowl, mix together the vinegar, salt, brown sugar, coriander seeds, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Add the meat strips to the bowl and coat them in the marinade. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
Remove the meat from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
Hang the meat strips in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area. You can use a biltong box or simply hang the strips on a rack or a clothes hanger.
Allow the meat to dry for 3-5 days, until it is firm and dry to the touch.
Slice the biltong into thin strips and serve as a snack.

recipes.name: Momos
recipes.description: Momos are a traditional Nepalese dish that are similar to dumplings. They are typically filled with meat or vegetables and served with a spicy tomato-based dipping sauce.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground meat, onions, cilantro, scallions, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, and black pepper.
Place a heaping teaspoon of the filling in the center of each dumpling wrapper.
Fold the wrapper in half to form a half-moon shape and pinch the edges together to seal.
Place the momos on a greased steamer basket and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve hot with spicy tomato dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Dal Bhat
recipes.description: Dal Bhat is a traditional Nepalese dish that consists of lentil soup and rice. It is usually served with a side of pickles or chutney, and sometimes with a vegetable curry or meat dish.
instructions: Rinse the lentils and add them to a large pot with 4 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are soft.
In a separate pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is soft and translucent.
Add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper to the pan and stir to combine.
Add the onion and spice mixture to the pot with the lentils and stir to combine.
Simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the soup has thickened.
Serve hot with cooked rice and pickles or chutney on the side.

recipes.name: Stroopwafels
recipes.description: Stroopwafels are a classic Dutch treat consisting of two thin waffle cookies sandwiching a layer of caramel syrup.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, yeast, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
In a separate bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the egg, milk, vanilla extract, and salt.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until just combined.
Form the dough into a ball and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Preheat a waffle iron to medium-high heat.
Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place them on the waffle iron, flattening slightly with a spatula.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the waffles are golden brown and crispy.
Use a sharp knife to cut the waffles in half horizontally, creating two thin cookies.
Spread caramel syrup on the flat side of one cookie, then top with the other cookie to create a sandwich.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pavlova
recipes.description: Pavlova is a popular dessert in New Zealand made of a crispy meringue shell topped with whipped cream and fresh fruit. It's named after the famous Russian ballerina Anna Pavlova, who toured New Zealand in the 1920s.
ingredients: Fresh fruit (e.g. strawberries, kiwi fruit, passionfruit) for topping
instructions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form.
Gradually add the sugar, one tablespoon at a time, while continuing to beat the egg whites.
Beat in the vinegar, vanilla extract, and cornstarch.
Spoon the meringue mixture onto the prepared baking sheet, forming a 9-inch (23-cm) circle with slightly raised edges.
Bake for 1 hour or until the meringue is crispy and lightly golden on the outside.
Turn off the oven and leave the meringue inside to cool completely.
In a separate bowl, whip the cream until stiff peaks form.
Spread the whipped cream over the top of the cooled meringue, leaving a small border around the edges.
Top the cream with fresh fruit and serve.

recipes.name: Lamb Roast
recipes.description: Lamb roast is a classic New Zealand main course, often served for Sunday dinner or special occasions. It's typically seasoned with rosemary and garlic and served with roasted vegetables.
ingredients: 4-6 cups assorted root vegetables (e.g. potatoes, carrots, parsnips), peeled and chopped
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix together the garlic, rosemary, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Rub the mixture all over the lamb roast, making sure to coat it evenly.
Place the lamb in a roasting pan and surround it with the chopped vegetables and onion.
Roast for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the lamb is cooked to your desired doneness and the vegetables are tender.
Let the lamb rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving with the roasted vegetables.

recipes.name: Gallo Pinto
recipes.description: Gallo Pinto is a traditional Nicaraguan dish that consists of rice and beans. It is typically served for breakfast, but can be eaten at any time of day.
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Rinse the rice and add it to a pot with 2 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover.
Simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.
In a separate pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, bell pepper, and garlic and sauté for 3-5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Add the black beans, cumin, salt, and black pepper to the pan and stir to combine.
Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir to combine.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the rice and beans are heated through.
Serve hot, topped with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: Jollof rice is a popular West African dish that is enjoyed in many countries, including Niger. It is a one-pot rice dish that is typically made with tomatoes, onions, and a blend of spices. Jollof rice can be served on its own or with a side of meat or vegetables.
instructions: In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is soft.
Add the bell peppers and continue to sauté for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the smoked paprika, cumin, coriander, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
Add the diced tomatoes, rice, and chicken broth to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot.

recipes.name: Yassa Chicken
recipes.description: Yassa chicken is a traditional Senegalese dish that has become popular in many West African countries, including Niger. It is a flavorful chicken dish that is marinated in a tangy sauce made from lemons, onions, and spices. Yassa chicken is usually served with rice and a side of vegetables.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, onions, garlic, ground mustard, thyme, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat in the marinade.
Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Add the remaining marinade to the skillet and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Serve the chicken hot with the sauce drizzled over the top.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: Jollof Rice is a popular West African dish that is commonly eaten in Nigeria. It is a one-pot rice dish that is cooked in a tomato-based sauce with spices and vegetables.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chopped onion and bell pepper and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
Add the tomato paste, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, dried thyme, salt, and cayenne pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the can of diced tomatoes and stir to combine.
Add the rice to the pot and stir to coat the grains with the tomato mixture.
Add the water to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Suya
recipes.description: Suya is a popular Nigerian street food that is made with skewered and grilled meat that is seasoned with a spicy peanut marinade.
ingredients: 1 lb. beef or chicken, cut into thin strips
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the peanut butter, vegetable oil, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cumin, coriander, salt, and cayenne pepper.
Add the meat to the bowl and stir to coat it in the marinade.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or up to overnight.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Thread the meat onto the skewers and grill for 3-4 minutes per side, or until the meat is cooked through.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Kimchi
recipes.description: Kimchi is a traditional fermented vegetable dish from North Korea. It is made with napa cabbage, radish, garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes, and is typically served as a side dish or used as a condiment.
ingredients: 1 head napa cabbage, chopped into bite-sized pieces
1/2 lb. daikon radish, peeled and chopped into thin strips
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the napa cabbage and daikon radish.
In a separate bowl, mix together the garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, fish sauce, salt, and sugar.
Add the spice mixture to the bowl with the cabbage and radish, and mix well to coat.
Add the scallions and water to the bowl and mix well.
Pack the kimchi mixture into a jar or other airtight container, pressing down firmly to remove any air pockets.
Cover the jar with a lid and let it sit at room temperature for 1-2 days, or until it has started to ferment.
Once the kimchi is fermented to your liking, transfer it to the refrigerator to slow down the fermentation process.
Serve cold as a side dish or condiment.

recipes.name: Naengmyeon
recipes.description: Naengmyeon is a popular cold noodle dish from North Korea. It is made with thin, chewy noodles made from buckwheat and potato starch, and is served in a cold broth made from beef or dongchimi (a type of water kimchi). The noodles are usually topped with sliced beef, pear, cucumber, and a boiled egg.
instructions: Cook the naengmyeon noodles according to the package instructions.
In a large bowl, mix together the beef broth or dongchimi, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, mustard powder, and black pepper.
Divide the noodles into four bowls.
Top each bowl with sliced beef, pear, cucumber, and boiled egg.
Pour the broth over the noodles and serve cold.

recipes.name: Tavche Gravche
recipes.description: Tavche gravche is a traditional dish made with beans and vegetables, typically served as a main course.
instructions: Soak the beans in water overnight.
Drain and rinse the beans and add them to a large pot with 6 cups of water.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
In a separate pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft.
Add the tomato paste, paprika, thyme, oregano, salt, and black pepper to the pan and stir to combine.
Add the vegetable mixture to the pot with the beans and stir to combine.
Simmer for an additional 30-40 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot as a main course.

recipes.name: Ajvar
recipes.description: Ajvar is a traditional roasted red pepper and eggplant spread that is often served as a condiment or dip.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Slice the bell peppers and eggplant in half lengthwise and place them on a baking sheet.
Roast in the oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft and the skins are charred.
Remove from the oven and let cool slightly.
Peel the skins off the peppers and eggplant and discard.
Place the roasted vegetables in a blender or food processor with the garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and black pepper.
Blend until smooth.
Transfer the spread to a bowl and serve as a condiment or dip.

recipes.name: Kjøttkaker
recipes.description: Kjøttkaker are traditional Norwegian meatballs made with ground beef, pork, and veal. They are typically served with boiled potatoes, lingonberry jam, and a creamy brown sauce.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, pork, and veal with the onion, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, black pepper, and nutmeg.
Shape the mixture into meatballs, about 2 inches in diameter.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the meatballs to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides.
Remove the meatballs from the skillet and set them aside.
Add the flour to the skillet and stir until the flour is lightly browned.
Gradually stir in the beef broth and heavy cream, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Return the meatballs to the skillet and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the meatballs are cooked through.
Serve hot with boiled potatoes, lingonberry jam, and the creamy brown sauce.

recipes.name: Lefse
recipes.description: Lefse is a traditional Norwegian flatbread made with potatoes, flour, and milk. It is typically served with butter and sugar, or with savory toppings like cheese and cured meats.
ingredients: Butter and sugar, for serving (or other toppings of your choice)
instructions: Mash the boiled potatoes in a large mixing bowl.
Add the softened butter and milk to the potatoes and mix until well combined.
Add the flour and salt to the mixture and stir until a smooth dough forms.
Divide the dough into small balls, about the size of a golf ball.
On a floured surface, roll each ball of dough into a thin, flat circle.
Heat a large griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the lefse on the griddle for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until lightly browned and cooked through.
Serve hot with butter and sugar, or with other toppings of your choice.

recipes.name: Shuwa
recipes.description: Shuwa is a traditional Omani dish made by slow-cooking marinated lamb in an underground pit oven. The lamb is marinated in a blend of spices and wrapped in banana or palm leaves to keep it moist.
ingredients: 2 kg lamb shoulder or leg, bone-in
instructions: Mix the oil, onions, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, black pepper, cinnamon, cardamom, and salt in a bowl to make a marinade.
Rub the marinade all over the lamb, making sure it's evenly coated.
Wrap the lamb in banana or palm leaves, making sure it's tightly wrapped to keep the juices in.
Dig a pit in the ground and light a fire in it to heat up the stones.
Once the stones are hot, place the wrapped lamb on top of them and cover the pit with more leaves and soil to create an oven-like environment.
Leave the lamb to cook for 12-24 hours, depending on its size and how well-done you want it.
Once the lamb is cooked, remove it from the pit, unwrap it, and serve it with rice and salad.

recipes.name: Harees
recipes.description: Harees is a popular Omani dish made from boiled wheat and meat. It is typically served during Ramadan and other special occasions.
instructions: Wash the wheat and soak it in water for a few hours, or overnight.
In a large pot, boil the wheat in 10 cups of water until it's soft and mushy.
In a separate pot, boil the meat until it's cooked through and tender.
Remove the meat from the pot and shred it using a fork or food processor.
Add the shredded meat, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, turmeric, black pepper, cinnamon, cardamom, salt, and ghee to the pot with the wheat.
Using an immersion blender or food processor, blend the mixture until it's smooth and creamy.
Simmer the mixture over low heat for 30-60 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
Serve hot, garnished with ghee and cinnamon, if desired.

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.description: Biryani is a popular Pakistani dish that consists of spiced rice and meat or vegetables. It is typically served with raita (a yogurt-based condiment) and a salad.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless chicken or beef, cut into small pieces
instructions: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear, then soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the onion is soft and translucent.
Add the ginger and garlic and sauté for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Add the chicken or beef to the pot and sauté until browned on all sides.
Add the cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot with the spiced meat.
Add the water to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot with raita and a salad on the side.

recipes.name: Ulkelkang
recipes.description: Ulkelkang is a traditional Palauan dish that features grilled fish wrapped in banana leaves, along with coconut and taro leaves. The fish is marinated in a mixture of lime juice, garlic, and soy sauce before grilling, which gives it a tangy and savory flavor.
ingredients: 4-6 fish fillets (such as mahi-mahi or red snapper)
instructions: Combine lime juice, garlic, soy sauce, coconut milk, salt, and black pepper in a bowl to make a marinade.
Add the fish fillets to the marinade and let them sit for at least 30 minutes.
Wrap each fish fillet in banana leaves, along with a few taro leaves.
Grill the fish on medium heat for 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
Serve hot with rice and additional taro leaves for wrapping.

recipes.name: Musakhan
recipes.description: Musakhan is a traditional Palestinian dish that features roasted chicken on a bed of bread and caramelized onions. The dish is typically served on a large platter and shared among family and friends.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chicken, sliced onion, olive oil, sumac, cinnamon, allspice, salt, and black pepper.
Mix well until the chicken is coated with the spices.
Arrange the chicken and onions in a single layer in a baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
While the chicken is cooking, toast the pita bread in the oven for a few minutes until slightly crispy.
To serve, arrange the pita bread on a large platter and top with the chicken and onions. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Maftoul Salad
recipes.description: Maftoul Salad is a Palestinian dish made with maftoul, a type of hand-rolled couscous made from whole wheat flour. The salad also features fresh vegetables and herbs, as well as a tangy lemon and olive oil dressing.
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and add the maftoul.
Cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the maftoul is tender.
Drain the maftoul and rinse it with cold water to cool it down.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked maftoul, diced cucumber, tomato, and bell pepper, as well as the chopped parsley, mint, and cilantro.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine.
Serve cold or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Arroz con Pollo
recipes.description: Arroz con pollo is a classic Panamanian dish that consists of chicken and rice cooked together with vegetables and spices. It is a popular comfort food and is often served for family meals and special occasions.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside.
Add the onion, bell peppers, and garlic to the pot and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are soft.
Add the cumin, oregano, turmeric, paprika, cayenne pepper, and black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the rice to the pot and stir to coat it with the spices.
Add the chicken broth to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the chicken pieces back to the pot and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
Stir in the frozen peas and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the peas are heated through.
Add salt to taste and serve hot.

recipes.name: Mumu
recipes.description: Mumu is a traditional Papua New Guinean dish that is prepared by cooking meat, vegetables, and other ingredients in an underground oven. It is often served at special occasions and celebrations.
ingredients: 2 lbs. pork, beef, or chicken, cut into large pieces
2 lbs. sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into large pieces
2 lbs. taro, peeled and cut into large pieces
2 lbs. cassava, peeled and cut into large pieces
instructions: Dig a hole in the ground that is big enough to accommodate all of the ingredients.
Line the hole with banana leaves or aluminum foil.
Build a fire in the hole using firewood and allow it to burn down to hot coals.
Place the large stones on top of the hot coals to heat them up.
Mix the meat, vegetables, onions, garlic, ginger, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl.
Place the mixture on top of the hot stones in the hole.
Cover the mixture with more banana leaves or aluminum foil.
Cover the hole with dirt and allow the food to cook for 2-3 hours.
Remove the dirt and banana leaves/aluminum foil and serve the Mumu hot.

recipes.name: Kaukau and Taro Chips
recipes.description: Kaukau (sweet potato) and taro chips are a popular snack in Papua New Guinea. They are often served with coconut chutney or tomato sauce.
ingredients: 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
2 taro roots, peeled and thinly sliced
instructions: Mix the flour, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl.
Add the sweet potato and taro slices to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.
Heat the oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot to 375°F.
Add the sweet potato and taro slices to the hot oil in small batches and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove the chips from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Serve the chips hot with coconut chutney or tomato sauce.

recipes.name: Sopa Paraguaya
recipes.description: Sopa Paraguaya is a traditional cornbread from Paraguay. It is made with cornmeal, cheese, and onions, and is typically served as a side dish with grilled meats.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, mix together the cornmeal, cheese, and onions.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the oil, milk, eggs, and salt.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
Serve warm as a side dish.

recipes.name: Chipa Guazú
recipes.description: Chipa Guazú is a traditional Paraguayan corn casserole that is similar to a quiche. It is made with corn, cheese, and eggs, and is typically served as a side dish with grilled meats.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cut the kernels off the corn cobs and place them in a large bowl.
Add the cheese, onions, red and green bell peppers, milk, eggs, salt, and black pepper to the bowl and stir until well combined.
Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown on top and set in the middle.
Serve warm as a side dish.

recipes.name: Lomo Saltado
recipes.description: Lomo Saltado is a classic Peruvian dish that combines marinated strips of sirloin steak with onions, tomatoes, and French fries. It is typically served with rice.
ingredients: 1 lb. sirloin steak, cut into thin strips
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, red wine vinegar, garlic, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
Add the sirloin steak strips and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
In a large pan or wok, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
Add the marinated sirloin strips and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned on all sides.
Add the onion and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Add the tomato and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot with cooked French fries and rice.

recipes.name: Ceviche
recipes.description: Ceviche is a refreshing and tangy seafood dish that is popular in Peru. It is made with raw fish that is marinated in lime juice and mixed with onions, peppers, and cilantro.
ingredients: 1 lb. fresh white fish, cut into bite-size pieces
1 ear of corn, cooked and sliced
instructions: In a bowl, mix together the fish, lime juice, onion, red bell pepper, cilantro, and jalapeño pepper.
Cover and refrigerate for 30-60 minutes, or until the fish is opaque and firm.
Add the salt and black pepper and stir to combine.
Serve chilled with cooked sweet potato and corn on the side.

recipes.name: Adobo Chicken
recipes.description: Adobo is a popular Filipino dish that involves cooking meat, seafood, or vegetables in a tangy mixture of vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and other spices. This recipe features chicken, but pork and seafood can also be used.
ingredients: 1 lb. chicken thighs, bone-in and skin-on
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the chicken, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, peppercorns, and bay leaves. Let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours in the refrigerator.
Add water to the pot, and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to medium and let the chicken simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Increase the heat to high and let the sauce boil until it has reduced and thickened, about 10 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken, skin side down, and cook until the skin is crispy and golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Flip the chicken and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and serve hot with the adobo sauce and rice.

recipes.name: Pancit Bihon
recipes.description: Pancit Bihon is a Filipino noodle dish made with thin rice noodles, vegetables, and meat or seafood. It is a popular dish served during celebrations and special occasions.
ingredients: 1/2 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced
1/2 cup green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Soak the bihon noodles in warm water for 10-15 minutes or until they are soft. Drain and set aside.
In a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
Add the onion and garlic and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until the onion is translucent.
Add the chicken and shrimp and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the shrimp turns pink.
Add the carrot, cabbage, and green beans and stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add the bihon noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, chicken broth, and black pepper to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until the noodles are heated through and the sauce is evenly distributed.
Serve hot and garnish with chopped scallions or cilantro, if desired.

recipes.name: Pierogi
recipes.description: Pierogi are a popular Polish dish consisting of filled dumplings. They can be filled with a variety of ingredients such as potatoes, cheese, meat, or sauerkraut.
instructions: To make the dough, mix together the flour and salt in a large bowl.
Add the egg and water and mix until the dough comes together.
Knead the dough for 5-10 minutes until it is smooth and elastic.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.
To make the filling, mix together the mashed potatoes, cheddar cheese, onions, butter, salt, and black pepper.
Roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness.
Cut out circles of dough using a biscuit cutter or drinking glass.
Place a heaping teaspoon of the filling in the center of each circle.
Fold the circle in half to form a half-moon shape and pinch the edges together to seal.
Boil the pierogi in salted water for 3-4 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and chopped chives.

recipes.name: Bigos
recipes.description: Bigos is a traditional Polish stew made with sauerkraut, various meats, and spices. It is often served during special occasions and holidays.
instructions: Rinse the sauerkraut and squeeze out any excess liquid.
In a large Dutch oven or pot, cook the sausage and bacon over medium heat until the bacon is crispy and the sausage is browned.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the bay leaves, caraway seeds, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the beef broth, diced tomatoes, pork shoulder, beef stew meat, and sauerkraut to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Bacalhau à Brás
recipes.description: Bacalhau à Brás is a popular Portuguese dish made with salt cod, onions, potatoes, and eggs. It is usually served with olives and parsley on top.
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into thin strips
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Boil the salt cod in a large pot for 10-15 minutes, until tender.
Drain the cod, remove any bones and flake the flesh.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until translucent.
Add the potatoes and continue cooking until they are cooked through but still firm.
Add the flaked cod and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the beaten eggs and stir until they are cooked.
Transfer the mixture to an oven-safe dish and bake for 10-15 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
Garnish with olives and parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pastel de Nata
recipes.description: Pastel de Nata is a delicious Portuguese pastry that originated in Lisbon. It is a small custard tart with a crispy shell and a creamy filling.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into circles to fit into a muffin tin.
Press the pastry circles into the muffin tin and prick the bottoms with a fork.
In a saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, sugar, and cornstarch until well combined.
Slowly pour the hot milk into the egg mixture, whisking constantly.
Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
Pour the custard into the prepared pastry shells, filling each about 3/4 full.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and the custard is set.
Sprinkle with cinnamon powder and serve warm.

recipes.name: Machboos
recipes.description: Machboos is a popular Qatari rice dish flavored with spices and usually made with meat or fish. This recipe uses chicken and is often served with a side of salad or yogurt.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
instructions: Heat ghee in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic and sauté until golden brown.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
Add chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, cinnamon powder, cardamom powder, and bay leaves.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add chicken broth and salt to taste. Bring to a boil.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Stir well to combine.
Cover the pot with a lid and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork and garnish with chopped cilantro.
Serve hot with a side of salad or yogurt.

recipes.name: Luqaimat
recipes.description: Luqaimat is a traditional Qatari dessert made of small dough balls that are deep-fried and then drizzled with sweet syrup. They are often served during Ramadan and other special occasions.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt.
Add warm water and stir until a smooth dough forms.
Cover the bowl with a cloth and let the dough rise for 1-2 hours.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or large pot over medium heat.
Using a spoon, drop small balls of dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
Remove the dough balls from the oil and place them on a paper towel to drain the excess oil.
In a saucepan, combine the honey, water, and cardamom powder.
Cook over low heat until the honey has dissolved and the mixture thickens slightly.
Drizzle the honey syrup over the fried dough balls and garnish with chopped pistachios.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Sarmale
recipes.description: Sarmale is a traditional Romanian dish consisting of cabbage rolls filled with minced meat and rice. It is typically served with sour cream and polenta.
ingredients: Sour cream and polenta, for serving
instructions: Remove the core from the cabbage and carefully separate the leaves.
Blanch the leaves in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then remove and set aside to cool.
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground pork, onion, rice, tomato paste, paprika, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Place a spoonful of the meat mixture in the center of each cabbage leaf and roll tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
Arrange the cabbage rolls in a large pot and pour in the water.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 2-3 hours, until the meat and rice are cooked through and the cabbage is tender.
Serve hot with sour cream and polenta.

recipes.name: Papanasi
recipes.description: Papanasi is a popular Romanian dessert consisting of fried doughnuts made with cottage cheese and served with sour cream and fruit preserves.
ingredients: Sour cream and fruit preserves, for serving
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the cottage cheese, flour, baking powder, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt.
Mix well until a dough forms.
Roll the dough into small balls and flatten them slightly into disc shapes.
Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
Fry the papanasi until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve hot with sour cream and fruit preserves.

recipes.name: Borscht
recipes.description: Borscht is a hearty soup that is a staple of Russian cuisine. It is made with beets, cabbage, carrots, potatoes, and sometimes meat or sausage. It is often served with a dollop of sour cream on top.
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the onion and carrot in a bit of oil over medium heat until the onion is translucent.
Add the beets, potatoes, cabbage, broth, and optional beef or sausage to the pot.
Add enough water to cover the vegetables and bring to a boil.
Add the tomato paste, red wine vinegar, bay leaves, and dill to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour, until the vegetables are tender.
Remove the bay leaves and serve hot, topped with a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.name: Pelmeni
recipes.description: Pelmeni are small dumplings that are a popular dish in Russia. They are typically filled with meat and served with sour cream or vinegar.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, onion, garlic, salt, and black pepper.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and 1 tablespoon of water.
Add the egg mixture to the beef mixture and stir to combine.
In another mixing bowl, combine the flour and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.
Add the water to the flour mixture and stir until a dough forms.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1/8-inch thickness.
Using a round cookie cutter or a glass, cut out circles of dough.
Place a small spoonful of the beef mixture in the center of each dough circle.
Fold the dough over the filling and pinch the edges together to seal.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the pelmeni to the boiling water and cook for 5-7 minutes, until they float to the surface.
Serve hot with sour cream or vinegar.

recipes.name: Ibiharage (Rwandan Beans)
recipes.description: Ibiharage is a traditional Rwandan dish made with beans, tomato sauce, and spices. It is often served with rice and avocado.
ingredients: 2 cups dried red beans, soaked overnight
instructions: Drain the soaked beans and rinse them.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until they are soft.
Add the beans, tomato sauce, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, and water to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 1 hour, or until the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with rice and avocado.

recipes.name: Isombe (Cassava Leaves with Eggplant and Peanut Sauce)
recipes.description: Isombe is a popular Rwandan dish made with cassava leaves, eggplant, and peanut sauce. It is often served with boiled plantains or rice.
instructions: Wash the cassava leaves and remove any tough stems.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until they are soft.
Add the eggplant and cook until it is tender.
Add the cassava leaves and vegetable broth to the pot and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the cassava leaves are cooked.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, paprika, and a little bit of water to make a smooth sauce.
Add the peanut sauce to the pot and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with boiled plantains or rice.

recipes.name: Fried Conch Fritters
recipes.description: These fried conch fritters are a popular snack in Saint Kitts and Nevis. They are made with conch meat, flour, and seasonings and are often served with a spicy dipping sauce.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, onion, garlic, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and baking powder.
Add the conch meat and stir until well combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and milk.
Add the egg mixture to the conch mixture and stir until a thick batter forms.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or deep fryer over medium-high heat.
Use a tablespoon to drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil.
Fry the fritters for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove the fritters with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with a spicy dipping sauce, if desired.

recipes.name: Stewed Saltfish and Dumplings
recipes.description: Stewed saltfish and dumplings is a hearty and comforting dish that is popular in Saint Kitts and Nevis. It is made with salted codfish and dumplings, and is often served with boiled yams or plantains.
ingredients: 1 lb salted codfish, soaked overnight and flaked
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the onion, garlic, and bell pepper in the vegetable oil until softened.
Add the flaked saltfish and stir to combine.
Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the saltfish is tender and the sauce has thickened.
While the saltfish is cooking, make the dumplings. In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder.
Add 3/4 cup of water and stir until a dough forms.
Divide the dough into small balls and drop them into the pot with the saltfish.
Cover the pot and simmer for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the dumplings are cooked through.
Serve hot with boiled yams or plantains, if desired.

recipes.name: Green Fig and Saltfish
recipes.description: Green fig and saltfish is a classic Saint Lucian dish made with boiled green bananas and salt cod, mixed together with spices and vegetables.
instructions: Boil the green bananas in salted water until tender, about 20-25 minutes.
While the bananas are boiling, soak the salt cod in cold water for about 1 hour to remove some of the salt.
Boil the salt cod in fresh water for 20-25 minutes until tender, then drain and flake it with a fork.
In a large pan, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion, green pepper, and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the flaked salt cod, thyme, and black pepper and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Peel and chop the cooked green bananas and add them to the pan with the salt cod mixture.
Stir everything together and cook for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with hot pepper sauce on the side, if desired.

recipes.name: Banana Fritters
recipes.description: Banana fritters are a popular dessert in Saint Lucia made with ripe bananas, flour, and sugar, fried until golden and crispy.
instructions: Peel the ripe bananas and mash them in a mixing bowl.
Add the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg to the bowl and stir to combine.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk and egg until well combined.
Add the milk and egg mixture to the banana mixture and stir until smooth.
Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
Drop spoonfuls of the banana batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Remove the fritters from the pan with a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel to drain off excess oil.
Serve warm as a dessert or snack.

recipes.name: Fried Jackfish
recipes.description: Fried Jackfish is a popular dish in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines made with fresh jackfish fillets, seasoned with a spicy blend of herbs and spices and fried until crispy.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together the salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper.
Season the jackfish fillets with the spice blend and coat them in flour.
In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the jackfish fillets and fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Remove from the skillet and drain on a paper towel.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and your favorite side dish.

recipes.name: Roasted Breadfruit
recipes.description: Roasted Breadfruit is a staple food in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. The breadfruit is roasted until the skin is charred and the flesh is tender, and then it is served with saltfish, butter, or any other savory accompaniments.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Using a sharp knife, make several deep cuts into the skin of the breadfruit.
Rub vegetable oil all over the breadfruit and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Place the breadfruit on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until the skin is charred and the flesh is tender.
Remove the breadfruit from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Cut the breadfruit into quarters and remove the core and seeds.
Serve the roasted breadfruit with your favorite savory accompaniments, such as saltfish or butter.

recipes.name: Palusami
recipes.description: Palusami is a traditional Samoan dish made with taro leaves and coconut milk. The dish is wrapped in banana leaves and baked in an umu, an underground oven.
instructions: Wash the taro leaves and remove the stems.
In a mixing bowl, combine the coconut milk, onion, garlic, and salt.
Lay out a large piece of banana leaf and place a layer of taro leaves on top.
Pour the coconut milk mixture over the taro leaves and spread it evenly.
Place another layer of taro leaves on top and repeat the process until all the ingredients are used up.
Wrap the banana leaves around the palusami to form a packet.
Place the palusami in an umu or bake in a conventional oven at 350°F for 1-2 hours.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Oka I'a
recipes.description: Oka I'a is a Samoan raw fish salad made with coconut cream, lime juice, and vegetables. It is a popular dish for special occasions and celebrations.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the fish and lime juice.
Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Drain the lime juice from the fish and add the coconut cream.
Mix well.
Add the onion, bell peppers, tomato, cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Stir to combine.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Torta Tre Monti
recipes.description: Torta Tre Monti, also known as Three Mountains Cake, is a traditional San Marinese dessert made with layers of chocolate and hazelnut cream between crisp layers of wafers. It is often served on special occasions and celebrations.
instructions: In a double boiler, melt the chocolate until smooth.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Add the powdered sugar to the cream and whisk until fully incorporated.
Add the hazelnut cream and whisk until fully combined.
Spread a thin layer of the hazelnut cream mixture on top of a wafer cookie and place another wafer on top.
Repeat with the remaining wafers and hazelnut cream mixture, creating layers of alternating chocolate and hazelnut cream between the wafers.
Cover the cake with the remaining hazelnut cream mixture, smoothing it out with a spatula.
Refrigerate the cake for at least 2 hours, or until set.
When ready to serve, cut the cake into slices and serve chilled.

recipes.name: Strozzapreti with Wild Asparagus
recipes.description: Strozzapreti with Wild Asparagus is a traditional San Marinese pasta dish made with handmade strozzapreti pasta and fresh wild asparagus. It is a simple and flavorful dish that highlights the fresh ingredients.
ingredients: 1 lb. fresh wild asparagus, trimmed and chopped
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the strozzapreti pasta according to package instructions, until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the asparagus and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the pan with the asparagus.
Toss the pasta and asparagus together, coating the pasta with the olive oil and asparagus flavors.
Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve hot.

recipes.name: Calulu de Peixe
recipes.description: Calulu de Peixe is a flavorful fish stew that is popular in São Tomé and Príncipe. It is typically made with fish, okra, tomatoes, and onions, and served with rice.
ingredients: 1 lb. fish fillets, cut into chunks
instructions: Heat the palm oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is translucent.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to soften.
Add the fish, okra, chicken broth, salt, and black pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the fish is cooked through and the okra is tender.
Serve with cooked rice.

recipes.name: Moqueca de Banana-pão
recipes.description: Moqueca de Banana-pão is a vegetarian dish that is popular in São Tomé and Príncipe. It is made with green bananas, coconut milk, onions, and spices.
instructions: Heat the palm oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is translucent.
Add the sliced bananas, coconut milk, salt, black pepper, paprika, and ground coriander.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the bananas are tender.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Kabsa
recipes.description: Kabsa is a popular rice dish in Saudi Arabia, made with spiced rice and meat. It is often served with a side of salad and is a staple of Saudi cuisine.
ingredients: 2 lbs. chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until translucent.
Add the meat and cook until browned.
Add the tomato puree and spices and stir to combine.
Add the rice and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Add the raisins and almonds and cook for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Haneeth
recipes.description: Haneeth is a traditional Saudi Arabian dish of roasted meat, usually lamb or chicken, that is slowly cooked in a pit oven for several hours. The result is tender, juicy meat that is flavored with aromatic spices.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the cumin, coriander, paprika, salt, black pepper, garlic, and onion together in a bowl to make a spice rub.
Rub the spice mixture all over the lamb or chicken.
Place the meat in a deep baking dish and pour the water over the top.
Drizzle the vegetable oil over the meat.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 2-3 hours, until the meat is tender and falls off the bone.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Thiéboudienne
recipes.description: Thiéboudienne, also known as ceebu jën, is the national dish of Senegal. It is a flavorful one-pot meal made with fish, rice, and vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, eggplant, and cassava.
ingredients: 2 lbs. fish (red snapper, grouper, or tilapia), cleaned and cut into fillets
instructions: Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper and set aside.
In a large pot or dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, parsley, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
Add the cabbage, carrots, and eggplant and stir to combine.
Add enough water to cover the vegetables and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the vegetables are cooked.
Add the rice and more water if necessary to cover the rice.
Lay the fish fillets on top of the rice and vegetables.
Cover the pot and cook over low heat for 20-25 minutes, until the rice is tender and the fish is cooked through.
Serve hot with additional sauce if desired.

recipes.name: Thiakry
recipes.description: Thiakry, also known as degue or couscous pudding, is a popular dessert in Senegal made with couscous, sweetened milk, and fruit such as mangoes or pineapples.
instructions: Cook the couscous according to package directions and set aside.
In a saucepan, heat the milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt over medium heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
Add the raisins and cook for 5-10 minutes, until the milk has thickened.
Remove from heat and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked couscous and the milk mixture.
Stir in the diced mango or pineapple.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

recipes.name: Ćevapi
recipes.description: Ćevapi are a popular grilled dish made of minced meat, usually beef or lamb, and spices. They are often served with lepinja, a type of bread, onions, and ajvar, a red pepper relish.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, grated onion, minced garlic, paprika, salt, black pepper, and baking soda.
Knead the mixture with your hands until well combined and smooth.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Divide the meat mixture into small portions and shape them into small sausage shapes.
Grill the sausages for 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through.
Serve the Ćevapi with lepinja bread, chopped onions, and ajvar.

recipes.name: Gibanica
recipes.description: Gibanica is a traditional Serbian pastry made with phyllo dough and various fillings, such as cheese, spinach, and meat. It is usually served as a savory breakfast or snack.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a mixing bowl, combine the crumbled feta cheese, cottage cheese, sour cream, eggs, and vegetable oil. Mix well.
Brush a baking dish with oil and lay a sheet of phyllo dough in the bottom of the dish.
Brush the phyllo with oil and add another layer of phyllo on top.
Repeat the process, layering the phyllo sheets and brushing each layer with oil, until half of the phyllo dough is used.
Spread the cheese mixture over the phyllo layers.
Continue layering the remaining phyllo dough, brushing each layer with oil, until the top layer is reached.
Brush the top layer with oil and bake for 45-50 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and crispy.
Let the Gibanica cool for 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Poulet Coco
recipes.description: Poulet Coco is a traditional Seychellois dish made with chicken cooked in a coconut milk sauce, flavored with garlic, ginger, and curry powder.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the onions, garlic, and ginger and sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
Add the curry powder and stir until well combined.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and cook, covered, for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Banana Cake
recipes.description: Banana cake is a popular dessert in Seychelles, made with mashed ripe bananas, flour, sugar, and other ingredients.
ingredients: 1/2 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, until well combined.
Add the mashed bananas and vanilla extract and stir until well combined.
Gradually add the flour mixture to the banana mixture, alternating with the milk, until well combined.
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Let the cake cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Groundnut Stew
recipes.description: Groundnut Stew is a popular dish in Sierra Leone made with chicken, peanut butter, and vegetables. It is usually served with rice.
instructions: Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken legs and brown them on both sides.
Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside.
Add the onions and garlic to the pot and cook until the onions are translucent.
Add the tomato paste and cook for another minute.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Stir in the peanut butter and cayenne pepper.
Add the sweet potatoes and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until they are tender.
Add the spinach and cook until it wilts.
Return the chicken legs to the pot and cook until they are cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Jollof Rice
recipes.description: Jollof Rice is a West African dish that is popular in Sierra Leone. It is a spicy tomato-based rice dish that is often served with chicken or fish.
instructions: Rinse the rice in cold water and set it aside.
In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and cook until they are translucent.
Add the bell peppers and garlic and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and stir to combine.
Add the diced tomatoes and chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add the rice, smoked paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper.
Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until the rice is cooked through.
Serve hot with chicken or fish.

recipes.name: Hainanese Chicken Rice
recipes.description: Hainanese Chicken Rice is a popular Singaporean dish that consists of poached chicken and rice cooked in chicken broth. It is often served with cucumber slices, chili sauce, and a bowl of soup.
instructions: Rinse the chicken and pat dry. Rub salt over the skin and inside the cavity.
In a pot, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add the chicken and bring the water back to a boil. Turn off the heat and cover the pot. Let the chicken sit in the hot water for 30 minutes.
In a rice cooker or a pot, add the rice and 3 cups of chicken stock. Add the ginger, garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir to combine.
Place the pot on the stove and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for 15-20 minutes, until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Remove the chicken from the pot and plunge it into a bowl of ice water for 5 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the ice water and pat dry. Cut the chicken into serving pieces.
Serve the chicken with the rice, cucumber slices, chili sauce, and a bowl of soup.

recipes.name: Laksa
recipes.description: Laksa is a spicy noodle soup that is popular in Singapore. It is typically made with coconut milk, shrimp, and a variety of spices and herbs.
instructions: Cook the rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent.
Add the curry powder and chili paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the coconut milk and chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes, until pink and cooked through.
Stir in the fish sauce and sugar.
Divide the cooked noodles among four bowls.
Ladle the hot soup over the noodles.
Garnish with lime wedges and cilantro leaves and serve hot.

recipes.name: Bryndzové Halušky
recipes.description: Bryndzové halušky is a popular Slovakian dish made from potato dumplings (halušky) and a soft sheep cheese called bryndza. It is typically served with fried bacon or smoked sausage.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the grated potatoes, flour, egg, water, and a pinch of salt until a dough forms.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Using a spoon or a special halušky maker, drop small pieces of the dough into the boiling water.
Cook the halušky until they float to the surface, then remove them with a slotted spoon and place them in a large serving dish.
In a small pan, melt the butter over low heat and add the crumbled bryndza cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and smooth.
Fry the diced bacon or sliced sausage in a separate pan until crispy.
Pour the bryndza sauce over the halušky and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped chives and the crispy bacon or sausage, if desired.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Prekmurska gibanica
recipes.description: Prekmurska gibanica is a traditional layered cake from the Prekmurje region in northeastern Slovenia. It is made with poppy seeds, walnuts, apples, raisins, and quark cheese, and it is usually served as a dessert.
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C.
In a mixing bowl, combine the poppy seeds, walnuts, apples, raisins, quark cheese, sugar, cinnamon, and 2 beaten eggs.
Roll out the puff pastry and cut it into four equal parts.
Place one part in a greased baking dish and brush with melted butter.
Add a layer of the filling mixture and repeat with the remaining pastry and filling, ending with a layer of pastry on top.
Mix the remaining 2 beaten eggs with sour cream and pour over the top of the cake.
Bake for 1 hour, until golden brown.
Allow to cool before serving.

recipes.name: Jota
recipes.description: Jota is a traditional soup from the Primorska region in southwestern Slovenia. It is made with sauerkraut, beans, potatoes, and smoked pork, and it is usually served as a main course.
ingredients: Sour cream and chopped parsley for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent.
Add the smoked pork and cook until browned.
Add the paprika and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the sauerkraut, beans, potatoes, bay leaf, salt, and pepper, and enough water to cover the ingredients.
Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the potatoes are tender.
Serve hot, garnished with sour cream and chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Kokoda
recipes.description: Kokoda is a traditional dish from the Solomon Islands made with raw fish marinated in citrus juice and coconut milk. It is often served as an appetizer or a light meal.
ingredients: 1 red chili pepper, seeded and minced
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine the lime juice and lemon juice.
Add the diced fish and stir to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
In a separate bowl, combine the coconut milk, onion, tomato, bell pepper, and chili pepper.
Add the marinated fish and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled, garnished with chopped cilantro.

recipes.name: Pisupo
recipes.description: Pisupo is a hearty stew from the Solomon Islands made with canned corned beef, onions, tomatoes, and cabbage. It is often served with rice or bread.
ingredients: Cooked rice or bread for serving
instructions: In a large pot, cook the chopped onion until translucent.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes, until soft.
Add the canned corned beef and stir to combine.
Add the chopped cabbage and water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes, until the cabbage is tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add hot sauce to taste, if desired.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Somali Rice
recipes.description: Somali rice is a fragrant rice dish made with basmati rice, spices, and vegetables. It is often served with meat or chicken.
instructions: Wash the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent.
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, and cardamom and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the grated carrot and frozen peas and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Add the rice and stir to coat in the spice mixture.
