Add the water and bring to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer for 18-20 minutes, until the rice is tender and the water has been absorbed.
Remove from heat and let the rice rest for 5-10 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.

recipes.name: Bobotie
recipes.description: Bobotie is a South African dish made with spiced minced meat and topped with a mixture of egg and milk. It is usually served with yellow rice and chutney.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Soak the bread in the milk and then mash it with a fork.
In a large skillet, cook the onions until they are soft.
Add the meat and cook until it is browned.
Add the curry powder, turmeric, coriander, and cumin and stir to combine.
Add the raisins and almonds and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add the mashed bread and milk to the skillet and stir to combine.
Beat the eggs and pour them over the top of the meat mixture.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, until the top is golden brown.
Serve with yellow rice and chutney.

recipes.name: Braai
recipes.description: Braai is a traditional South African barbecue that involves grilling meat over an open flame. It is a popular social activity and usually involves a variety of meats, such as beef, lamb, and boerewors (a type of sausage).
ingredients: Assorted meats (such as beef, lamb, and boerewors)
Wood or charcoal for the grill
instructions: Start the fire and let it burn down to hot coals.
Season the meats with salt and pepper.
Place the meats on the grill and cook to your desired level of doneness.
Serve with your choice of sides, such as pap (a type of porridge made from maize) and chakalaka (a spicy relish).

recipes.name: Bibimbap
recipes.description: Bibimbap is a Korean rice bowl dish that consists of rice topped with a variety of seasoned vegetables, meat, and egg. It is served with gochujang, a spicy red pepper paste.
ingredients: 1 lb. beef or pork, sliced thin
instructions: Cook the rice according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced meat and cook until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
In the same skillet, heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the zucchini and carrot and cook until slightly softened. Set aside.
In a pot of boiling water, blanch the bean sprouts and spinach for 1-2 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Set aside.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
In a non-stick skillet, heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the beaten eggs and cook, stirring occasionally, until scrambled.
To assemble the bibimbap, place a scoop of rice in a bowl.
Arrange the cooked meat, vegetables, and eggs on top of the rice.
Drizzle with sesame oil and serve with gochujang sauce.

recipes.name: Japchae
recipes.description: Japchae is a Korean dish made with sweet potato glass noodles stir-fried with vegetables, meat, and seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil.
ingredients: 1 lb. beef or pork, sliced thin
instructions: Cook the sweet potato glass noodles according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the sliced meat and cook until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
In the same skillet, heat 1 tbsp. vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onion, carrot, and bell pepper and cook until slightly softened.
Add the garlic and spinach and cook until the spinach is wilted.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and sesame seeds.
Add the cooked noodles, meat, and vegetables to the skillet.
Pour the soy sauce mixture over the top and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Asida
recipes.description: Asida is a staple food in South Sudan made from a mixture of sorghum or millet flour and water. It is typically served with soup or stew.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Add the sorghum or millet flour to the pot and stir continuously until the mixture becomes thick and doughy.
Remove the pot from heat and allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.
Using wet hands, form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Serve with soup or stew.

recipes.name: Bamia (Okra Stew)
recipes.description: Bamia is a popular dish in South Sudan made with okra, tomatoes, and onions. It is typically served with rice or bread.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the onions and garlic and cook until translucent.
Add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the sliced okra to the pot and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes, until the okra is tender.
Serve with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Paella
recipes.description: Paella is a traditional Spanish rice dish that originated in the Valencia region. It is typically made with saffron, chicken, rabbit, and a variety of vegetables and seafood.
ingredients: 1/2 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a small saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a simmer. Add the saffron threads and let steep for 10 minutes.
In a large paella pan or skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and red bell pepper and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the rice, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper to the pan and stir to coat the rice with the oil and spices.
Add the white wine to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has been absorbed.
Add the diced tomatoes and chicken broth to the pan and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and let cook for 10 minutes.
Add the frozen peas, shrimp, and mussels to the pan and cover with a lid. Cook until the shrimp are pink and the mussels have opened, about 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Tortilla Española
recipes.description: Tortilla Española, also known as Tortilla de Patatas, is a classic Spanish dish made with eggs, potatoes, and onions. It is often served as a tapa or light meal.
ingredients: 2 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the sliced potatoes to the pan and stir to combine with the onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper.
Add the cooked potatoes and onion to the egg mixture and stir to combine.
Return the mixture to the skillet and cook over low heat until the bottom is set, about 10 minutes.
Flip the tortilla over and cook until the other side is set, about 5 minutes.
Transfer the tortilla to a plate and let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A staple dish in Sri Lankan cuisine, chicken curry is a flavorful and spicy dish made with chicken, coconut milk, and a variety of spices.
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Add the mustard seeds and dried red chilies, and fry until the mustard seeds start to pop.
Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and fry until the onion is soft and translucent.
Add the chicken and fry until browned on all sides.
Add the turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, fennel seeds, cinnamon stick, and salt, and fry for a few minutes until fragrant.
Add the coconut milk and curry leaves, and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, covered, for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

recipes.name: Mulukhiyah
recipes.description: Mulukhiyah is a popular dish in Sudan and the Middle East made from the leaves of the mulukhiyah plant. The leaves are cooked with chicken or beef and served over rice.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken or beef, cut into pieces
instructions: Wash the mulukhiyah leaves and set aside.
In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
Add the chicken or beef and cook until browned.
Add the coriander, cumin, turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper to the pot and stir to coat the meat.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and let simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the mulukhiyah leaves to the pot and cook for an additional 15 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Kisra
recipes.description: Kisra is a traditional Sudanese bread made from sorghum flour. It is often served with stews and soups.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the sorghum flour, water, and salt. Mix well to form a batter.
Cover the bowl with a cloth and let the batter ferment for 24 hours.
After 24 hours, heat a nonstick pan over medium heat. Pour about 1/2 cup of the batter onto the pan and spread it out into a thin layer.
Cook for about 3 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and crispy.
Repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve warm with stews and soups.

recipes.name: Roti
recipes.description: Roti is a popular Surinamese dish that consists of a flatbread, also called roti, served with a curry. The curry is typically made with potatoes, chicken, and a variety of spices.
instructions: For the Roti:
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the vegetable oil and warm water to the bowl and stir until the dough comes together.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for 5-10 minutes, until it is smooth and elastic.
Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
Cover the dough balls with a damp cloth and let rest for 30 minutes.
Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Roll out each dough ball into a thin circle, about 8-10 inches in diameter.
Cook the roti on the skillet or griddle for 1-2 minutes on each side, until lightly browned and cooked through.
For the Curry:
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, cloves, and cayenne pepper to the pot and stir to coat the chicken and vegetables with the spices.
Add the diced potatoes and chicken broth to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat to low and let cook for 20-30 minutes, until the potatoes are tender and the curry has thickened.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the curry with the roti.

recipes.name: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.description: Swedish meatballs are a classic Swedish dish made with ground beef and pork, breadcrumbs, and spices, served with a creamy gravy and lingonberry sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, combine breadcrumbs and milk. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine onion, egg, ground beef, ground pork, allspice, nutmeg, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Add the breadcrumb mixture to the meat mixture and stir until just combined.
Shape the mixture into meatballs, about 1 inch in diameter.

Melt 2 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add half of the meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, about 6 minutes. Transfer the meatballs to a baking sheet and repeat with the remaining meatballs.
Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
Meanwhile, make the gravy. Melt the remaining 2 tbsp butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes.
Gradually whisk in the beef broth and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook until thickened, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve the meatballs with the gravy and lingonberry sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Cheese Fondue
recipes.description: Cheese Fondue is a classic Swiss dish made with melted cheese and served in a communal pot over a small burner. It is typically served with bread cubes, boiled potatoes, and other dipping options.
ingredients: 1 loaf crusty bread, cut into cubes
instructions: Rub the inside of a fondue pot or a heavy-bottomed saucepan with the garlic.
Add the white wine and lemon juice to the pot and heat over medium-low heat until it simmers.
In a separate bowl, mix together the grated Gruyere and Emmental cheeses with the cornstarch, kirsch (if using), and a pinch each of black pepper and nutmeg.
Add the cheese mixture to the pot and stir constantly until the cheese is fully melted and the mixture is smooth.
Keep the fondue warm over low heat or a fondue burner, stirring occasionally.
Serve with the bread cubes and any other dipping options you prefer, such as boiled potatoes or vegetables.

recipes.name: Rösti
recipes.description: Rösti is a Swiss dish made with grated potatoes that are fried in butter or oil until crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It is often served as a side dish with meat or vegetables.
instructions: Grate the potatoes using the large holes of a box grater or a food processor.
Place the grated potatoes in a large bowl and season with salt. Toss to combine.
Melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the grated potatoes to the pan and spread them out into an even layer.
Cook the rösti until golden brown and crispy on the bottom, about 10-15 minutes.
Place a large plate upside down over the skillet and flip the rösti onto the plate.
Melt the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter in the skillet and slide the rösti back into the skillet, cooked side up.
Cook until the second side is golden brown and crispy, about 10-15 minutes more.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste and serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.name: Fattoush
recipes.description: Fattoush is a refreshing salad made with crispy pita chips, fresh vegetables, and a tangy dressing. It is a popular dish in Syria and throughout the Middle East.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Cut the pita breads into bite-sized pieces and place them on a baking sheet.
Drizzle the pita pieces with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and sprinkle with sumac and salt.
Bake the pita pieces for 10-15 minutes or until crispy and golden brown. Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, tomato, cucumber, parsley, mint, and green onions.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Add the dressing to the salad and toss to combine.
Add the cooled pita chips to the salad and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
recipes.description: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki is a popular Tanzanian dish made from a stiff porridge of maize flour (Ugali) and a side dish of sautéed kale (Sukuma Wiki). It is a staple food in Tanzania and is usually eaten with a variety of stews and curries.
instructions: In a large saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add salt to taste.
Gradually add the maize flour, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent lumps from forming. Keep stirring until the mixture becomes thick and starts to pull away from the sides of the pot.
Cover the pot and let the ugali cook for about 10-15 minutes over low heat, stirring occasionally.
In another pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add the chopped kale, tomato, curry powder, black pepper, and chili flakes (if using). Stir to combine and cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the kale is tender.
Serve the ugali hot with the sukuma wiki on the side.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.description: Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish that is a staple of Thai cuisine. It typically consists of rice noodles, shrimp, tofu, bean sprouts, and a sweet and savory sauce.
instructions: Soak the rice noodles in cold water for 30 minutes to soften them.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds.
Add the shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink, about 2 minutes.
Push the shrimp to one side of the wok and add the eggs to the other side. Scramble the eggs until set.
Add the tofu, bean sprouts, and green onions to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Drain the rice noodles and add them to the wok. Stir-fry until the noodles are cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.
Pour the sauce over the noodles and stir to coat. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped peanuts and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Tom Yum Soup
recipes.description: Tom Yum Soup is a spicy and sour soup that is a popular dish in Thailand. It is typically made with shrimp, lemongrass, lime juice, chili peppers, and a variety of other herbs and spices.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the broth to a boil over high heat.
Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and Thai chilies to the pot. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the shrimp, mushrooms, and tomato to the pot and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Stir in the fish sauce and lime juice and simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the cilantro leaves.
Serve hot, garnished with additional cilantro if desired.

recipes.name: Tchakpalo
recipes.description: Tchakpalo is a traditional Togolese soup made with peanuts and spices. It is typically served with fufu, a starchy staple made from cassava or yams.
ingredients: 2 cups unsalted peanuts, shelled and peeled
2-3 scotch bonnet peppers or other hot peppers, chopped (optional)
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and sauté until they are soft and translucent.
Add the diced tomatoes and cook until they are soft and have released their juices.
Add the peanuts to the pot and stir to combine.
Add enough water to the pot to cover the ingredients and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the peanuts are soft.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
Using a blender or food processor, blend the mixture until it is smooth and creamy.
Return the soup to the pot and reheat over low heat.
Add salt to taste and stir in the chopped hot peppers (if using).
Serve hot with fufu or another starchy staple.

recipes.name: Klui Klui
recipes.description: Klui Klui is a popular Togolese snack made from mashed plantains and beans, fried until crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the mashed plantains, cooked black-eyed peas, chopped onion, all-purpose flour, salt, and black pepper.
Using your hands, form the mixture into small, flat cakes about 1/4 inch thick.
In a large skillet, heat enough vegetable oil to cover the bottom of the pan over medium-high heat.
Add the plantain cakes to the pan, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
Fry the plantain cakes until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Remove the plantain cakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain off excess oil.
Serve the Klui Klui warm as a snack or appetizer.

recipes.name: Lu Sipi (Tongan-style braised lamb shanks)
recipes.description: Lu Sipi is a traditional Tongan dish made by braising lamb shanks in a flavorful sauce. It is often served with root vegetables and rice.
instructions: Season the lamb shanks with salt and black pepper.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or other heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add the lamb shanks and brown on all sides, about 8-10 minutes total. Remove the lamb from the pot and set aside.
Add the onions and garlic to the pot and sauté until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and stir to combine with the onions and garlic.
Add the beef broth, water, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, rosemary, paprika, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and bay leaves. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Return the lamb shanks to the pot and add the chopped carrots, sweet potatoes, and taro roots.
Cover the pot and simmer over low heat for 2-3 hours, until the lamb is tender and falls off the bone.
Serve the Lu Sipi hot over cooked rice, with the vegetables and sauce spooned over the top.

recipes.name: Pelau
recipes.description: Pelau is a one-pot dish that is popular in Trinidad and Tobago. It is made with chicken, rice, and pigeon peas, and is seasoned with a blend of herbs and spices. Pelau is often served with a side of coleslaw or salad.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken, cut into small pieces
1 can pigeon peas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken pieces and brown on all sides.
Add the onion, garlic, bell pepper, and carrot. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
Add the brown sugar, thyme, oregano, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Stir to combine and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the rice to the pot and stir to coat with the spices.
Add the chicken broth and coconut milk to the pot, and stir to combine.
Add the pigeon peas to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover with a lid.
Cook for 25-30 minutes, until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Fluff the rice with a fork, and serve hot with coleslaw or salad.

recipes.name: Brik
recipes.description: Brik is a Tunisian appetizer made with a thin pastry shell that is filled with a mixture of tuna, egg, parsley, and harissa, and then deep-fried until crispy and golden brown. It is typically served with lemon wedges and harissa sauce.
ingredients: 8 sheets of brik or filo pastry
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Lemon wedges and harissa sauce for serving
instructions: In a medium bowl, mix together the tuna, beaten eggs, chopped parsley, harissa, salt, and black pepper.
Take one sheet of brik pastry and place it on a work surface. Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the tuna mixture onto the center of the pastry sheet.
Fold the pastry over the filling to make a square packet. Fold the sides of the pastry inwards to seal the packet.
Repeat with the remaining pastry sheets and filling.
Heat the vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or a deep fryer over medium-high heat.
Carefully place the briks in the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, turning once, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Remove the briks from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and harissa sauce.

recipes.name: Turkish Kebab
recipes.description: Turkish kebab is a popular street food made with marinated meat that is cooked on a skewer over an open flame. It is usually served with rice, salad, and flatbread.
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless lamb or beef, cut into 1 inch cubes
Wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, yogurt, tomato paste, lemon juice, paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, and garlic.
Add the meat to the bowl and stir to coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Thread the meat onto the skewers, leaving a little space between each piece.
Grill the kebabs for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve with rice, salad, and flatbread.

recipes.name: Ugandan Rolex
recipes.description: Ugandan Rolex is a popular street food in Uganda, consisting of a thin omelette wrapped around a filling of stir-fried vegetables and meat. It's usually served as a quick breakfast or snack.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Whisk the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and black pepper.
Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté the onions, tomatoes, green pepper, and grated carrot until tender.
Pour the eggs over the vegetables and cook until set, flipping once.
Place the chapati or tortilla wrap on a plate and place the omelette on top.
Roll the wrap tightly around the omelette, tucking in the sides as you go.
Serve hot as a breakfast or snack.

recipes.name: Borscht
recipes.description: Borscht is a classic Ukrainian soup made with beets, cabbage, and other vegetables. It is often served with sour cream and fresh dill.
ingredients: Sour cream and chopped fresh dill for serving
instructions: In a large pot, sauté the onion, carrots, and celery in oil until they are softened.
Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes more.
Add the grated beet and cabbage and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add the diced tomatoes, chicken or vegetable broth, bay leaf, and red wine vinegar.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and chopped fresh dill on top.

recipes.name: Varenyky
recipes.description: Varenyky are Ukrainian dumplings filled with potatoes, cheese, or meat. They are often served with sour cream or fried onions.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt.
Add the warm water and beaten egg, and mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for 5-7 minutes, or until it is smooth and elastic.
In a separate bowl, mix together the mashed potatoes, cheddar cheese, green onions, salt, and pepper.
Roll out the dough to 1/8 inch thickness and cut it into circles using a biscuit cutter or glass.
Place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center of each circle, then fold the dough over and pinch the edges to seal.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the varenyky to the pot and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
Serve the varenyky hot with sour cream and/or fried onions.

recipes.name: Machboos
recipes.description: Machboos is a popular Emirati dish made with spiced rice and meat (usually chicken, lamb, or goat). It is often served with a side of salad and a tangy tomato sauce called daqqus.
ingredients: 1 kg chicken or lamb, cut into pieces
2 teaspoons baharat spice mix (a blend of spices including cinnamon, cardamom, and cumin)
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro or parsley, for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and garlic and sauté until they are soft and translucent.
Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste and cook until the tomatoes have released their juices.
Add the meat to the pot and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add the baharat spice mix, turmeric, cumin, black pepper, and salt to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the rice to the pot and stir until it is coated with the spice mixture.
Add enough broth to the pot to cover the rice by about an inch.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer the machboos for about 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a serving platter.
Garnish the machboos with chopped cilantro or parsley and serve with daqqus and a side salad.

recipes.name: Fish and Chips
recipes.description: Fish and chips is a classic British dish consisting of deep-fried fish and thick-cut chips (French fries). It is typically served with tartar sauce and mushy peas.
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into thick chips
4 fillets of white fish (such as cod, haddock, or pollock)
Tartar sauce and mushy peas, for serving
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
Slowly pour in the beer, whisking constantly, until the batter is smooth and thick.
In a large pot, heat about 2 inches of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 180°C (350°F).
Dip each fish fillet into the batter, shaking off any excess, then carefully lower it into the hot oil.
Fry the fish fillets for about 5-6 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove the fish from the oil with a slotted spoon and place it on a wire rack to drain off any excess oil.
While the fish is frying, spread the chips out on a baking sheet and toss them with a little vegetable oil and salt.
Bake the chips in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until they are golden and crispy.
Serve the fish and chips hot, with tartar sauce and mushy peas on the side.

recipes.name: Hamburger
recipes.description: A classic American dish, the hamburger is a sandwich made with a ground beef patty, typically served on a bun with various toppings like lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, and cheese.
ingredients: Vegetable oil (for the grill or pan)
instructions: Preheat a grill or heat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Divide the ground beef into four equal portions and form each portion into a patty that is about 1/2-inch thick.
Using your thumb, make a small indentation in the center of each patty to prevent it from puffing up while cooking.
Season both sides of the patties with salt and pepper.
If using a grill, brush the grates with oil. If using a skillet, add a tablespoon of oil to the pan.
Add the patties to the grill or skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes per side, or until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F for medium doneness.
If using cheese, add a slice to each patty during the last minute of cooking to allow it to melt.
Toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.
To assemble the hamburgers, place a patty on the bottom half of each bun and add toppings of your choice, such as lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickles.
Add ketchup, mustard, and/or mayo to the top half of the bun, if desired.
Place the top half of the bun on top of the toppings and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chivito
recipes.description: Chivito is a popular Uruguayan sandwich made with grilled steak, ham, bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise. It is often served with french fries and a cold beer.
ingredients: 1 pound beef sirloin or flank steak
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Season the steak with salt and black pepper to taste.
Heat a grill or a skillet over high heat and brush it with oil.
Grill or pan-fry the steak for 3-4 minutes per side, or until it is cooked to your liking.
Remove the steak from the heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
While the steak is resting, fry the bacon and eggs in a separate pan.
Slice the hamburger buns and toast them lightly.
Spread a tablespoon of mayonnaise on each half of the buns.
Place a slice of ham on the bottom half of each bun, followed by a slice of mozzarella cheese.
Slice the steak into thin strips and place it on top of the cheese.
Top the steak with a fried egg, a slice of tomato, and a leaf of lettuce.
Place the top half of the bun on the sandwich and press down lightly.
Serve the chivito with french fries and a cold beer.

recipes.name: Asado
recipes.description: Asado is a traditional Uruguayan barbecue that consists of various cuts of beef, pork, and sausages grilled over an open flame. It is usually served with chimichurri sauce, grilled vegetables, and a bottle of Tannat wine.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Prepare the grill and heat the charcoal until it is white-hot.
Season the beef and pork with salt and black pepper to taste.
Place the beef short ribs and flank steak on the grill and cook for 10-15 minutes per side, or until they are medium-rare or to your liking.
Grill the pork sausage for 10-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through.
While the meat is grilling, slice the bell peppers and onions into thick strips.
Place the bell peppers and onions on the grill and cook until they are tender and slightly charred.
Remove the meat and vegetables from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
Slice the meat into thin strips and arrange them on a large platter.
Serve the asado with chimichurri sauce, grilled vegetables, and a bottle of Tannat wine.

recipes.name: Plov
recipes.description: Plov is a traditional Uzbek dish made with rice, meat, onions, and carrots. It is often served with a side of salad and yogurt.
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and garlic and sauté until they are soft and translucent.
Add the cubed meat to the pot and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add the grated carrots to the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are softened.
Add the cumin, paprika, turmeric, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the rice to the pot and stir until it is coated with the spice mixture.
Add enough broth to the pot to cover the rice by about an inch.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer the plov for about 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid has been absorbed.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a serving platter.
Garnish the plov with chopped parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Lap Lap
recipes.description: Lap lap is a traditional dish from Vanuatu made with grated root vegetables (such as taro, cassava, or yam) that are mixed with coconut milk, wrapped in banana leaves, and baked in an earth oven. Lap lap is often served with a side of island cabbage salad.
ingredients: 4 cups grated root vegetables (such as taro, cassava, or yam)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the grated root vegetables, coconut milk, chopped onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, and black pepper.
Divide the mixture into four portions.
Place one portion of the mixture on a banana leaf and spread it out to form a thin layer.
Sprinkle a quarter of the grated coconut meat over the top of the mixture.
Fold the banana leaf over the mixture to enclose it completely, then wrap the entire package tightly in another banana leaf.
Repeat with the remaining three portions of the mixture and grated coconut meat.
Preheat an earth oven or conventional oven to 350°F.
Place the wrapped lap lap packages in the oven and bake for about 1 hour, or until the vegetables are tender and the coconut milk has been absorbed.
Remove the lap lap from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before unwrapping the banana leaves and serving the lap lap with a side of island cabbage salad.

recipes.name: Island Cabbage Salad
recipes.description: Island cabbage salad is a refreshing side dish that is commonly served with traditional dishes in Vanuatu. The salad is made with shredded cabbage, grated carrots, sliced cucumber, and a tangy dressing made with lime juice, honey, and soy sauce.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro or parsley, for garnish
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, grated carrots, and sliced cucumber.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the lime juice, honey, and soy sauce.
Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat.
Garnish the salad with chopped cilantro or parsley and serve alongside traditional Vanuatuan dishes, such as lap lap.

recipes.name: Arepa
recipes.description: Arepa is a popular Venezuelan dish made from cornmeal dough that is shaped into small, round patties and then cooked on a griddle or in the oven. Arepas can be filled with a variety of ingredients, including cheese, meat, and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 cups precooked white cornmeal (also known as masarepa)
1/2 cup grated queso blanco or mozzarella cheese
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the precooked white cornmeal, warm water, salt, and vegetable oil. Mix well until the dough comes together and is smooth.
Divide the dough into 8-10 equal portions and shape each one into a small, round patty.
Heat a griddle or non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the arepas to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove the arepas from the pan and let them cool slightly. Use a knife to slice them open horizontally, creating a pocket for the filling.
Fill each arepa with grated queso blanco or mozzarella cheese, shredded cooked chicken, diced avocado, and chopped fresh cilantro.
Serve the arepas hot with hot sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Pho
recipes.description: Pho is a popular Vietnamese soup made with a rich, aromatic broth and thin rice noodles. It is typically served with thinly sliced beef or chicken, fresh herbs, bean sprouts, and a side of lime and chili peppers.
ingredients: 2 pounds beef bones, cut into pieces
instructions: In a large pot, add the beef bones and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and rinse the bones.
Rinse the pot and return the bones to the pot. Add the onion and ginger and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour.
Remove the bones, onion, and ginger from the pot and discard. Skim any fat from the surface of the broth.
Add the star anise, cloves, cinnamon stick, coriander seeds, and fennel seeds to the pot. Simmer for another hour.
Strain the broth through a fine mesh strainer and discard the solids. Return the broth to the pot and add the salt, sugar, and fish sauce. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and divide among 4-6 bowls.
Divide the sliced beef among the bowls. Ladle the hot broth over the beef and noodles.
Serve the pho with the green onions, cilantro, mint, basil, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and chili peppers on the side. Diners can add these toppings to their pho as desired.

recipes.name: Saltah
recipes.description: Saltah is a traditional Yemeni dish that consists of a hearty stew made with meat, vegetables, and a spicy broth, served with a side of flatbread. It is often considered the national dish of Yemen.
ingredients: 1 lb lamb or beef, cut into small pieces
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
Flatbread or pita bread, for serving
instructions: In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onions and garlic and sauté until they are soft and translucent.
Add the chopped tomatoes and green chili peppers and cook until the tomatoes have released their juices.
Add the meat to the pot and cook until it is browned on all sides.
Add the ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, black pepper, and salt to the pot and stir to combine.
Add enough water to the pot to cover the meat by about an inch.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer the saltah for about 1 hour, or until the meat is tender and the vegetables are fully cooked.
In a separate pot, boil the eggs until they are hard-boiled, then peel them and set them aside.
To serve, spoon the saltah into bowls and top each bowl with a boiled egg and some chopped cilantro.
Serve the saltah with flatbread or pita bread on the side.

recipes.name: Nshima
recipes.description: Nshima is a staple food in Zambia, made from maize meal and eaten with a variety of stews and relishes. It is similar to other African porridges like ugali and pap.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Slowly add the maize meal to the pot, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Reduce the heat to low and continue to stir the mixture until it becomes thick and forms a smooth, stiff dough.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
Using your hands, form the nshima into balls or patties and serve with stew or relish.

recipes.name: Chikanda
recipes.description: Chikanda, also known as African polony, is a popular street food in Zambia made from ground peanuts and cassava flour. It is often served with tomato and onion relish.
instructions: In a blender or food processor, grind the peanuts until they are finely ground but not turned into peanut butter.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground peanuts, cassava flour, salt, coriander, cumin, and paprika.
Add the water to the bowl and stir until the mixture forms a stiff dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and flatten them slightly into patties.
In a large pot, bring water to a boil.
Add the chikanda patties to the pot and cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are firm and cooked through.
Remove the chikanda from the pot and let them cool for a few minutes.
Serve with tomato and onion relish.

recipes.name: Sadza
recipes.description: Sadza is a staple food in Zimbabwe made from finely ground maize (corn) cooked with water to a thick porridge-like consistency. It is typically served with a variety of stews or relishes made with meat, vegetables, or beans.
instructions: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil.
Reduce the heat to low and slowly add the maize meal to the pot while stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
Continue stirring the mixture until it thickens and begins to pull away from the sides of the pot.
Cover the pot and let the sadza simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add salt to taste and stir well.
Serve the sadza hot with stew or relish of your choice.

recipes.name: Nyama Choma
recipes.description: Nyama Choma is a popular barbecue dish in Zimbabwe made with grilled meat (usually beef or goat) that is marinated in a flavorful spice mixture before being grilled over an open flame.
ingredients: 2 lbs beef or goat meat, cut into large pieces
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the vegetable oil, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, minced ginger, paprika, cumin, chili powder, black pepper, and salt to make the marinade.
Add the meat to the bowl and toss to coat it well with the marinade.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the meat marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat a grill to high heat.
Remove the meat from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
Grill the meat over high heat, turning occasionally, until it is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
Remove the meat from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
